sourceString: Preliminary Estimates of the Prevalence of Selected Underlying Health Conditions Among Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 — United States, February 12–March 28, 2020
targetString: Imididdigar Farko na Cigaba da Selectarancin Zaɓaɓɓen Yanayin Lafiya tsakanin Lafiyar masu haƙuri da Cutar Coronavirus 2019 - Amurka, Fabrairu 12-Maris 28, 2020

sourceString: On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization declared Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) a pandemic.
targetString: A ranar 11 ga Maris, 2020, Kungiyar Lafiya ta Duniya ta ayyana cutar Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) a matsayin annoba.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 571,678 confirmed COVID-19 cases and 26,494 deaths have been reported worldwide.
targetString: Ya zuwa Maris 28, 2020,an rawaito jimlar 571,678 sun tabbata masu COVID-19 da kuma mutuwar mutane 26,494 a duniya.

sourceString: Reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe disease include older age and the presence of at least one of several underlying health conditions.
targetString: Rahotanni daga China da Italiya sun nuna cewa dalilai masu haɗari ga mummunar cuta sun haɗa da tsufa da kasancewar aƙalla ɗaya daga cikin yanayin rashin lafiyar da dama.

sourceString: U.S. older adults, including those aged ≥65 years and particularly those aged ≥85 years, also appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated outcomes; however, data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
targetString: Tsofaffi manyan mutanen U.S., ciki har da waɗanda suna da shekaru daidai ko gaba da 65 da kuma waɗanda suna da manyan shekaru daidai ko gaba da 85, su ma sun bayyana cikin haɗari ga mummunan hadade sakamakon COVID-19; duk da haka, bayanan da ke nuna yanayin cuta wanda ke boye tsakanin marasa lafiyar COVID-19 na U.S. ba a ba da rahoton su ba.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, U.S. states and territories have reported 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases to CDC, including 7,162 (5.8%) for whom data on underlying health conditions and other known risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections were reported.
targetString: Tun daga Maris 28, 2020, Jihohi da yankuna na U.S. sun ba da rahoton maganganun 122,653 na CVID-19 ga CDC, ciki har da 7,162 (5.8%) wanda bayanan abubuwan da ke tattare da yanayin rashin lafiya da sauran sanannun abubuwan haɗari don mummunan sakamako daga cututtukan numfashi.

sourceString: Among these 7,162 cases, 2,692 (37.6%) patients had one or more underlying health condition or risk factor, and 4,470 (62.4%) had none of these conditions reported.
targetString: Daga cikin waɗannan lamarin cuta 7,162, 2,692 (37.6%) marasa lafiya suna da ɗaya ko sama da ke tattare da wasu cututtuka ko haɗari lamari, da 4,470 (62.4%) basu da waɗannan yanayin da aka ruwaito.

sourceString: The percentage of COVID-19 patients with at least one underlying health condition or risk factor was higher among those requiring intensive care unit (ICU) admission (358 of 457, 78%) and those requiring hospitalization without ICU admission (732 of 1,037, 71%) than that among those who were not hospitalized (1,388 of 5,143, 27%).
targetString: Adadin marasa lafiyar COVID-19 tare da aƙalla mai wata ciwon da ke a boye ko haɗari kamuwa yana da girma tsakanin waɗanda ke sashin buƙatar tsananin kulawar kama gado (ICU) (358 na 457, kashi 78%) da waɗanda ke buƙatar kama gado a asibiti ICU (732 na 1,037, kashi 71%) fiye da wadanda ba su a asibiti (1,388 na 5,143, kashi 27%).

sourceString: The most commonly reported conditions were diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease.
targetString: Yawancin yanayin da aka bayar da rahoton su ne mellitus na ciwon sukari, cutar huhu, da cutar zuciya.

sourceString: These preliminary findings suggest that in the United States, persons with underlying health conditions or other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections appear to be at a higher risk for severe disease from COVID-19 than are persons without these conditions.
targetString: Wadannan binciken na farko sun ba da shawarar cewa a Amurka, mutanen da ke da yanayin rashin lafiya ko kuma wasu halaye masu haɗari don mummunan sakamako daga kamuwa da cututtukan numfashi sun kasance cikin haɗari mafi girma ga mummunan cuta daga COVID-19 fiye da mutane marasa waɗannan yanayin.

sourceString: Data from laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases reported to CDC from 50 states, four U.S. territories and affiliated islands, the District of Columbia, and New York City with February 12–March 28, 2020 onset dates were analyzed.
targetString: Bayanai daga dakin gwaje-gwaje na CVID-19 da aka tabbatar wa CDC daga jihohi 50, yankuna hudu na Amurka da tsibirin da ke da alaƙa, Gundumar Columbia, da New York City tare da 12 ga Maris - 28 ga Maris, 2020 kwanakin dabarun fara.

sourceString: Cases among persons repatriated to the United States from Wuhan, China, and the Diamond Princess cruise ship were excluded.
targetString: Damu'oi tsakanin mutanen da aka mayar da su Amurka daga Wuhan, China, da jirgin ruwa mai saukar ungulu irin su Diamond Princess an hana su.

sourceString: For cases with missing onset dates, date of onset was estimated by subtracting 4 days (median interval from symptom onset to specimen collection date among cases with known dates in these data) from the earliest specimen collection.
targetString: Game da kararrakin da ba a fara ba kwanakin farko, an kiyasta ranar farawa da rage 4 kwanakin (tazarar tsakani daga farkon bayyanuwa zuwa samfurin ranar karbawa tsakanin lamura tare da kwanakin da aka sani a cikin waɗannan bayanan) daga farkon samfurin da aka karba.

sourceString: Public health departments reported cases to CDC using a standardized case report form that captures information (yes, no, or unknown) on the following conditions and potential risk factors: chronic lung disease (inclusive of asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [COPD], and emphysema); diabetes mellitus; cardiovascular disease; chronic renal disease; chronic liver disease; immunocompromised condition; neurologic disorder, neurodevelopmental, or intellectual disability; pregnancy; current smoking status; former smoking status; or other chronic disease.
targetString: Sassan kiwon lafiyar jama'a sun ba da rahoto kamuwa da cuta zuwa CDC ta yin amfani da ingantaccen rahoton wanda ke ɗaukar bayanai (eh, a'a, ko ba a sani ba) a kan waɗannan halaye masu zuwa da abubuwan haɗari masu haɗari: cutar huhu na ƙwaƙwalwa (haɗe da cutar asma, ciwon huhun hanji [COPD], da emphysema); ciwon sukari mellitus; ciwon zuciya; ciwon koda, ciwon hanta na kullum; yanayin immunocompromised; cutar neurologic, neurodevelopment, ko cutar nakasar da hankali; ciki; yanayin shan taba yanzu; mai shan taba a da; ko wasu cututtukan masu tsanani.

sourceString: Data reported to CDC are preliminary and can be updated by health departments over time; critical data elements might be missing at the time of initial report; thus, this analysis is descriptive, and no statistical comparisons could be made.
targetString: Bayanan da aka ba da rahoto ga CDC sune farkon kuma ana iya sabunta su ta sassan kiwon lafiya akan lokaci; mai mahimmancin bayanan zai yiwu a ɓace lokacin rahoton farko; don haka, wannan bincike kwatanci ne, kuma ba za a yi kwatancen ƙididdiga ba.

sourceString: The percentages of patients of all ages with underlying health conditions who were not hospitalized, hospitalized without ICU admission, and hospitalized with ICU admission were calculated.
targetString: kididdigar yawan marasa lafiya na kowane tsararraki tare da yanayin rashin lafiya waɗanda ba su asibiti, asibiti ba tare da shigar da ICU ba, da kuma asibiti tare da shigarwar ICU.

sourceString: Percentages of hospitalizations with and without ICU admission were estimated for persons aged ≥19 years with and without underlying health conditions.
targetString: An kiyasta ƙimar asibiti tare da ba tare da shigar da ICU ba ga mutanen da ke shekara ≥19 tare da kuma ba tare da ƙarancin lafiya ba.

sourceString: This part of the analysis was limited to persons aged ≥19 years because of the small sample size of cases in children with reported underlying health conditions (N = 32).
targetString: Wannan yanki na binciken an iyakance shi ne ga mutanen da ke shekaru kasa da 19 saboda ƙananan samfurin samfurori a cikin yara waɗanda ke da rahoton rashin lafiyar yanayin (N = 32).

sourceString: To account for missing data among these preliminary reports, ranges were estimated with a lower bound including cases with both known and unknown status for hospitalization with and without ICU admission as the denominator and an upper bound using only cases with known outcome status as the denominator.
targetString: Don yin asarar bayanan da suka ɓace tsakanin waɗannan rahotannin farko, an kiyasta jeri yana da ƙananan iyaka ciki har da lokuta tare da yanayin da aka sani da kuma wanda ba a san halin ajiye a asibiti ba tare da ba tare da bada gadon ICU azaman kasa da kuma kan iyaka ta amfani da lamurra tare da sanannu sakamakon matsayi na kasa.

sourceString: Because of small sample size and missing data on underlying health conditions among COVID-19 patients who died, case-fatality rates for persons with and without underlying conditions were not estimated.
targetString: Saboda ƙaramin samfurin ƙira da bayanai da suka ɓace game da yanayin rashin lafiya a tsakanin marasa lafiya na COVID-19 waɗanda suka mutu, ba a ƙididdige ƙididdigar kamuwa da cuta ga mutane da kuma ba tare da yanayin zama ba.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 122,653 laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases (Figure) and 2,112 deaths were reported to CDC.
targetString: Tun daga Maris 28, 2020, jimlar kwayoyin cutar 122,653 wadanda aka tabbatar sun kamu da cutar COVID-19 (Figure) da kuma mutuwar mutane 2,112 zuwa CDC.

sourceString: Case report forms were submitted to CDC for 74,439 (60.7%) cases.
targetString: An gabatar da harkar rahoton zuwa CDC don 74,439 kashi (60.7%).

sourceString: Data on presence or absence of underlying health conditions and other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections (i.e., smoking and pregnancy) were available for 7,162 (5.8%) patients (Table 1).
targetString: Bayanai game da kasancewar ko rashin kasancewar da wasu cututtuka a boye da sauran lamarin haɗari don mummunan sakamako daga samun cutar hanyoyin numfashi (i.e., shan sigari da ciki) sun kasance ga marasa lafiya 7,162 (5.8%) (Tebur 1).

sourceString: Approximately one third of these patients (2,692, 37.6%), had at least one underlying condition or risk factor.
targetString: Kimanin kashi ɗaya bisa uku na waɗannan marasa lafiya kashi (2,692, 37.6%), suna da aƙalla ɗaya cikin yanayin rashin lafiya ko haɗari.

sourceString: Diabetes mellitus (784, 10.9%), chronic lung disease (656, 9.2%), and cardiovascular disease (647, 9.0%) were the most frequently reported conditions among all cases.
targetString: Ciwon sukari mellitus (784, 10.9%), cutar huhu (656, 9.2%), da cututtukan zuciya (647, 9.0%) sune yanayin da aka fi yawan samun rahoton su a cikin dukkan lokuta.

sourceString: Among 457 ICU admissions and 1,037 non-ICU hospitalizations, 358 (78%) and 732 (71%), respectively occurred among persons with one or more reported underlying health condition.
targetString: A cikin yardawar 457 U na ICU da 1,037 marasa aikin asibiti na asibiti, 358 (78%) da 732 (71%), bi da bi sun kasance tsakanin mutane ɗaya ko fiye da aka bayar da rahoton rashin lafiyar.

sourceString: In contrast, 1,388 of 5,143 (27%) COVID-19 patients who were not hospitalized were reported to have at least one underlying health condition.
targetString: A wata bangare, marasa lafiya daga COVID-19 su 1,388 na 5,143 (27%) ba a ajiye su a asibiti ba an ba da rahoton cewa suna da aƙalla wata ciwo a boye guda daya.

sourceString: Among patients aged ≥19 years, the percentage of non-ICU hospitalizations was higher among those with underlying health conditions (27.3%–29.8%) than among those without underlying health conditions (7.2%–7.8%); the percentage of cases that resulted in an ICU admission was also higher for those with underlying health conditions (13.3%–14.5%) than those without these conditions (2.2%–2.4%) (Table 2).
targetString: Daga cikin marasa lafiya masu shekaru ≥19, yawan marasa asibiti na ICU ya fi girma a tsakanin waɗanda ke da yanayin rashin lafiya kashi (27.3% –29.8%) fiye da waɗanda ba tare da mahimmancin yanayin lafiya ba kashi (7.2% –7.8%); da yawan shari'o'in da suka haifar da shigarwar ICU suma sun kasance mafi girma ga waɗanda ke da yanayin rashin lafiya kashi (13.3% –14.5%) fiye da waɗanda ba tare da waɗannan yanayin ba kashi (2.2% –2.4%) (Tebur 2).

sourceString: Small numbers of COVID-19 patients aged < 19 years were reported to be hospitalized (48) or admitted to an ICU (eight).
targetString: kananan lambobin COVID-19 marasa lafiya waɗanda ke da shekaru <19 an ba da rahoton cewa suna asibiti (48) ko shigar da su a cikin ICU (takwas).

sourceString: In contrast, 335 patients aged < 19 years were not hospitalized and 1,342 had missing data on hospitalization.
targetString: A wata bangare, marasa lafiya guda 335 masun shekaru < 19 and kama su gado a asibiti 1,342 ba su da bayanan ko an taba kama su gado cikin asibiti.

sourceString: Among all COVID-19 patients with complete information on underlying conditions or risk factors, 184 deaths occurred (all among patients aged ≥19 years); 173 deaths (94%) were reported among patients with at least one underlying condition.
targetString: A cikin duk marasa lafiya na COVID-19 tare da cikakkun bayanai game da yanayin da ke ciki ko abubuwan haɗari, mutuwar 184 ya faru (duk a cikin marasa lafiya masu shekaru ≥19); An bayar da rahoton mutuwar kashi 173 (94%) a cikin marasa lafiya da ke da matsala ɗaya aƙalla.

sourceString: Among 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases reported to CDC as of March 28, 2020, 7,162 (5.8%) patients had data available pertaining to underlying health conditions or potential risk factors; among these patients, higher percentages of patients with underlying conditions were admitted to the hospital and to an ICU than patients without reported underlying conditions.
targetString: Daga cikin rahoton masun kamu da cutar CoVID-19 su 122,653 a U.S. da aka ba da rahoto ga CDC daga Maris 28, 2020, 7,162 kashi (5.8%) marasa lafiya suna da bayanai dangane da yanayin rashin lafiya ko abubuwan da ke haifar da haɗari; a tsakanin wadannan marasa lafiya, mafi girman kashi na marasa lafiya da yanayin da aka shigar a asibiti da kuma wani ICU fiye da marasa lafiya ba tare da rahoton muhimmin yanayin.

sourceString: These results are consistent with findings from China and Italy, which suggest that patients with underlying health conditions and risk factors, including, but not limited to, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, COPD, coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular disease, chronic renal disease, and smoking, might be at higher risk for severe disease or death from COVID-19.
targetString: Wadannan sakamakon sun yi daidai da binciken da aka samu daga China da Italiya, wadanda suka ba da shawarar marasa lafiya da ke tattare da yanayin kiwon lafiya da abubuwan da ke tattare da hadarin, wadanda suka hada da, amma ba a iyakance su ba, da cutar sankarar bargo, hauhawar jini, COPD, cututtukan jijiyoyin zuciya, cututtukan cerebrovascular, cututtukan koda, da shan sigari , na iya kasancewa cikin haɗari mafi girma don cutar mai tsanani ko mutuwa daga COVID-19.

sourceString: This analysis was limited by small numbers and missing data because of the burden placed on reporting health departments with rapidly rising case counts, and these findings might change as additional data become available.
targetString: Wannan ƙididdigar ta iyakance ta ƙananan lambobi da bayanai da suka ɓace saboda nauyin da aka ɗora akan rahoton sassan kiwon lafiya tare da ƙididdigar haɓaka na hanzari, kuma waɗannan binciken na iya canzawa yayin da ƙarin bayanan ya kasance.

sourceString: It is not yet known whether the severity or level of control of underlying health conditions affects the risk for severe disease associated with COVID-19.
targetString: Har yanzu ba a san ko tsananin ko matakin sarrafa yanayin rashin lafiyar ya shafi hadarin kamuwa da cutar mai alaƙa da COVID-19 ba.

sourceString: Many of these underlying health conditions are common in the United States: based on self-reported 2018 data, the prevalence of diagnosed diabetes among U.S. adults was 10.1%, and the U.S. age-adjusted prevalence of all types of heart disease (excluding hypertension without other heart disease) was 10.6% in 2017.
targetString: Yawancin wadannan yanayin rashin lafiyar sun zama ruwan dare a Amurka: dangane da bayanan kai da aka bayar na shekarar 2018, yawan cutar da aka gano a tsakanin manya na Amurka ya kai kashi 10.1%, da kuma yanayin tsufa na Amurka na kowane nau'in cututtukan zuciya (ban da hauhawar jini ba tare da sauran cututtukan zuciya) sun kasance 10.6% a cikin 2017.

sourceString: The age-adjusted prevalence of COPD among U.S. adults is 5.9%, and in 2018, the U.S. estimated prevalence of current asthma among persons of all ages was 7.9%.
targetString: Mamayewar COPD-da-daidaituwa tsakanin tsofaffi na Amurka shine kashi 5.9%, kuma a cikin 2018, ƙididdigar mamayar Amurkawa a halin yanzu na Asma tsakanin mutane a kowane rukunnin shekaru shine kashi 7.9%.

sourceString: CDC continues to develop and update resources for persons with underlying health conditions to reduce the risk of acquiring COVID-19.
targetString: CDC tana ci gaba da haɓaka da sabunta albarkatu ga mutanen da ke da yanayin rashin lafiya don rage haɗarin samun COVID-19.

sourceString: The estimated higher prevalence of these conditions among those in this early group of U.S. COVID-19 patients and the potentially higher risk for more severe disease from COVID-19 associated with the presence of underlying conditions highlight the importance of COVID-19 prevention in persons with underlying conditions.
targetString: Kiyasin kdididdigar mafi girma daga cikin waɗannan yanayin tsakanin waɗanda ke cikin wannan farkon rukunin marasa lafiya na COVID-19 na Amurka da yiwuwar haɗarin mafi girma don ƙarin ciwo mai mahimmanci daga COVID-19 wanda ke haɗuwa da kasancewar yanayin yana nuna mahimmancin rigakafin COVID-19 a cikin mutane yanayin.

sourceString: The findings in this report are subject to at least six limitations.
targetString: Abubuwan da aka samo a cikin wannan rahoto suna ƙarƙashin ƙarancin iyaka shida.

sourceString: First, these data are preliminary, and the analysis was limited by missing data related to the health department reporting burden associated with rapidly rising case counts and delays in completion of information requiring medical chart review; these findings might change as additional data become available.
targetString: Da farko, waɗannan bayanan na farawa ne, kuma binciken ya tsaya domin ɓacewar bayanan da suka shafi sashen kiwon lafiyar wanda ke da nauyin bada rahoton da ya danganci haɓaka tashiwar masu kamuwa da cuta da jinkiri gamawar neman bayanin sake duba hoton ginshiƙi; waɗannan binciken na iya canzawa yayin da ƙarin bayanai suka samu.

sourceString: Information on underlying conditions was only available for 7,162 (5.8%) of 122,653 cases reported to CDC.
targetString: Bayanai game da yanayin da ke ciki sun kasance kawai don 7,162 (5.8%) na 122,653 lokuta da aka ruwaito ga CDC.

sourceString: It cannot be assumed that those with missing information are similar to those with data on either hospitalizations or underlying health conditions.
targetString: Ba za a iya ɗauka cewa waɗanda ke da bayanin ɓoyuwa suna kama da waɗanda ke da bayanai game da ko dai asibiti ko kuma yanayin rashin lafiyar.

sourceString: Second, these data are subject to bias in outcome ascertainment because of short follow-up time.
targetString: Na biyu, wadannan bayanan suna da bambancin ra'ayi ne a game da tabbacin sakamako saboda gajeren lokaci na biyo baya.

sourceString: Some outcomes might be underestimated, and long-term outcomes cannot be assessed in this analysis.
targetString: Wasu sakamakon za a iya raina su, kuma sakamakon binciken na dogon lokaci ba za a iya tantance su a cikin wannan bincike ba.

sourceString: Third, because of the limited availability of testing in many jurisdictions during this period, this analysis is likely biased toward more severe cases, and findings might change as testing becomes more widespread.
targetString: Na uku, saboda karancin gwaji a cikin masarautuka da yawa a cikin wannan lokacin, wannan bincike yana iya zama son kai ga mafi munanan yanayi, kuma binciken zai iya canzawa yayin da gwajin ya yadu.

sourceString: Fourth, because of the descriptive nature of these data, attack rates among persons with and without underlying health conditions could not be compared, and thus the risk difference of severe disease with COVID-19 between these groups could not be estimated.
targetString: Na huɗu, saboda yanayin waɗannan bayanan, yanayin harin a tsakanin mutane tare da ba tare da ƙarancin yanayin kiwon lafiya ba za a iya kwatantawa, kuma ta haka ba za a iya ƙayyade bambancin haɗari na mummunar cuta tare da COVID-19 tsakanin waɗannan rukunin ba.

sourceString: Fifth, no conclusions could be drawn about underlying conditions that were not included in the case report form or about different conditions that were reported in a single, umbrella category.
targetString: Na biyar, ba za a iya yanke shawara game da yanayin da ba a haɗa da su a cikin fan din rahoton ko game da yanayi daban-daban waɗanda aka ruwaito cikin guda ɗaya, rukuni ɗaya.

sourceString: For example, asthma and COPD were included in a chronic lung disease category.
targetString: Misali, maganin fuka da COPD an sanya su a rukunin cututtukan huhu.

sourceString: Finally, for some underlying health conditions and risk factors, including neurologic disorders, chronic liver disease, being a current smoker, and pregnancy, few severe outcomes were reported; therefore, conclusions cannot be drawn about the risk for severe COVID-19 among persons in these groups.
targetString: A ƙarshe, ga wasu halayen kiwon lafiya da dalilai masu haɗari, ciki har da rikicewar neurologic, cututtukan hanta mai tsanani, kasancewa mai shan sigari a yanzu, da juna biyu, 'yan sakamakon mummunan rauni ne aka ruwaito; saboda haka, ba za a iya yanke shawara ba kusantar da hankali game da mumunar haɗarin COVID-19 tsakanin mutane a cikin waɗannan rukunin.

sourceString: Persons in the United States with underlying health conditions appear to be at higher risk for more severe COVID-19, consistent with findings from other countries.
targetString: Mutanen da ke cikin Amurka tare da yanayin rashin lafiya suna bayyana cewa suna cikin haɗarin mai tsananin COVID-19, wanda ke daidai da bincike daga wasu ƙasashe.

sourceString: Persons with underlying health conditions who have symptoms of COVID-19, including fever, cough, or shortness of breath, should immediately contact their health care provider.
targetString: Mutanen da ke da yanayin rashin lafiya waɗanda ke da alamun COVID-19, gami da zazzabi, tari, ko gajeriyar numfashi, yakamata a tuntuɓi mai ba da lafiyarsu nan da nan.

sourceString: These persons should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19, through washing their hands; cleaning and disinfecting high-touch surfaces; and social distancing, including staying at home, avoiding crowds, gatherings, and travel, and avoiding contact with persons who are ill.
targetString: Wadannan mutane ya kamata su dauki matakai don kare kansu daga COVID-19, ta hanyar wanke hannayensu; tsaftacewa da kuma share manyan hanyoyin tabawa; da kuma nisantar da jama'a, gami da zama a gida, nisantar taron jama'a, haduwa, da tafiye-tafiye, da nisantar cudanya da mutanen da ba su da lafiya.

sourceString: Maintaining at least a 30-day supply of medication, a 2-week supply of food and other necessities, and knowledge of COVID-19 symptoms are recommended for those with underlying health conditions.
targetString: Kula da akalla samar da magunguna na kwanaki 30, wadatar abinci na sati 2 da sauran buƙatu, da kuma sanin alamun COVID-19 ana bada shawarar ga waɗanda ke da yanayin rashin lafiyar.

sourceString: All persons should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19 and to protect others.
targetString: Duk mutane ya kamata su ɗauki matakai don kare kansu daga COVID-19 kuma don kare wasu.

sourceString: All persons who are ill should stay home, except to get medical care; should not go to work; and should stay away from others.
targetString: Duk mutanen da basu da lafiya ya kamata su kwana a gida, sai dai don samun kulawar likita; kada yaje aiki; kuma ya kamata ya nisanta da wasu.

sourceString: This is especially important for those who work with persons with underlying conditions or who otherwise are at high risk for severe outcomes from COVID-19.
targetString: Wannan yana da mahimmanci musamman ga waɗanda ke aiki tare da mutanen da ke da yanayin rashin ƙarfi ko kuma waɗanda ba haka ba suna cikin haɗari don mummunan sakamako daga COVID-19.

sourceString: Community mitigation strategies, which aim to slow the spread of COVID-19, are important to protect all persons from COVID-19, especially persons with underlying health conditions and other persons at risk for severe COVID-19–associated disease (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf).
targetString: Dabarun ragewa al'umma aiki, wadanda suke da niyyar rage yaduwar COVID-19, suna da mahimmanci don kare duk mutane daga COVID-19, musamman mutane waɗanda ke da yanayin ciwon da ke boye da sauran mutane waɗanda ke cikin tsananin haɗarin cutar COVID-19 da cutar makamanta (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf).

sourceString: What is already known about this topic?
targetString: Me aka riga aka sani game da wannan batun?

sourceString: Published reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe COVID-19 disease include underlying health conditions, but data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
targetString: Rahotannin da aka buga daga China da Italiya sun nuna cewa dalilai masu haɗari ga mummunar cutar COVID-19 sun haɗa da ciwon da ke boye a jiki, amma bayanan da ke kwatanta ciwon wanda yake a boye tsakanin masu cutar COVID-19 U.S. ba a ba da rahoto ba.

sourceString: What is added by this report?
targetString: Me aka haɗa da wannan rahoton?

sourceString: Based on preliminary U.S. data, persons with underlying health conditions such as diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease, appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated disease than persons without these conditions.
targetString: Dangane da bayanan Amurkawa na farko, mutanen da ke da halin rashin lafiya kamar su ciwon sukari mellitus, cututtukan huhu, da cututtukan zuciya, da alama suna cikin haɗari ga mummunan cutar COVID-19-fiye da mutane ba tare da waɗannan yanayin ba.

sourceString: What are the implications for public health practice?
targetString: Menene illolin aikin kiwon lafiyar jama'a?

sourceString: Strategies to protect all persons and especially those with underlying health conditions, including social distancing and handwashing, should be implemented by all communities and all persons to help slow the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: Dabarun da zasu kare duk mutane musamman wadanda ke da matsalar rashin lafiya, gami da nisantar da jama'a da aikin hannu, yakamata a aiwatar da dukkanin al'ummomi da dukkan mutane don taimakawa rage jinkirin yaduwar COVID-19.

sourceString: Emergence of a Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19): Protocol for Extending Surveillance Used by the Royal College of General Practitioners Research and Surveillance Centre and Public Health England
targetString: Fitowar wani Sabon Coronavirus (COVID-19): Tsarin Jagorar Fadada Sa Ido da Amfani da Kwalejin Royal na Babban Kwararrun Bincike da Cibiyar Kula da Kulawa da Ingancin Kiwon Lafiyar Jama'a

sourceString: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) and Public Health England (PHE) have successfully worked together on the surveillance of influenza and other infectious diseases for over 50 years, including three previous pandemics.
targetString: Kwalejin Royal na Dukanan Kwararru wato (The Royal College of General Practitioners) (RCGP) Cibiyar Binciken Kulawar (RSC) da Ingantacciyar Kula da Lafiyar Jama'a na Ingila (PHE) sun samu nasarar yi aiki tare a kan kula da mura da kuma sauran cututtuka na fiye da shekaru 50, ciki har da uku da suka gabata cututtukan annoba.

sourceString: With the emergence of the international outbreak of the coronavirus infection (COVID-19), a UK national approach to containment has been established to test people suspected of exposure to COVID-19.
targetString: Sakamakon kamuwa da annobar cututtukan coronavirus ta duniya (COVID-19), an kafa tsarin kulawa na ƙasar UK don gwada mutanen da ake zargi da kamuwa da cutar ta COVID-19.

sourceString: At the same time and separately, the RCGP RSC's surveillance has been extended to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community as well as assess the effectiveness of the containment strategy.
targetString: A lokaci guda kuma daban, an kara fadada RCGP na RC don saka idanu akan sauye da kuma rarraba yanayin cutar COVID-19 a cikin al'umma tare da tantance ingancin dabarun tattara bayanan

sourceString: The aims of this study are to surveil COVID-19 in both asymptomatic populations and ambulatory cases with respiratory infections, ascertain both the rate and pattern of COVID-19 spread, and assess the effectiveness of the containment policy.
targetString: Manufar wannan binciken ita ce bincika COVID-19 a cikin yawan asymptomatic da yanayin ambulatory tare da kamuwa da cututtukan hanyar numfashi, tantance dukan adadin da tsarin yaduwar COVID-19, da kuma samun tasirin tsarin magantarwa.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC, a network of over 500 general practices in England, extract pseudonymized data weekly.
targetString: RCGP RSC, cibiyar sadarwa ce ta ayyukan yau da kullun mai fiye da ayyuka 500 a Ingila, suna fitar da bayanan maganganu masu yawa a mako-mako.

sourceString: This extended surveillance comprises of five components: (1) Recording in medical records of anyone suspected to have or who has been exposed to COVID-19.
targetString: Wannan ƙarin aikin sanya idanu yana kunshe da abubuwa guda biyar: (1) Rikodin a cikin bayanan likitanci na duk wani wanda ake zargi yana da ko ya kamu da cutar ta COVID-19.

sourceString: Computerized medical records suppliers have within a week of request created new codes to support this.
targetString: Masu samar da kayan aikin likitanci na kwamfuta suna da su a cikin sati guda na buƙatar ƙirƙirar sabbin lambobi don tallafawa wannan.

sourceString: (2) Extension of current virological surveillance and testing people with influenza-like illness or lower respiratory tract infections (LRTI)—with the caveat that people suspected to have or who have been exposed to COVID-19 should be referred to the national containment pathway and not seen in primary care.
targetString: (2) Tsawaita aikin binciken barologi na yau da gwaji da kuma gwada mutanen da ke da cutar mura ko ta cuta ta hanji (LRTI) - tare da kwatancen da mutane ke zargin cewa suna da ko sun kamu da COVID-19 ya kamata a koma ga hanyar kawarwa na ƙasa. kuma ba a gan shi a cikin kananun asibiti ba.

sourceString: (3) Serology sample collection across all age groups.
targetString: (3) Samun tarin samfuran Serology a duk tsararraki daban-daban.

sourceString: This will be an extra blood sample taken from people who are attending their general practice for a scheduled blood test.
targetString: Wannan zai zama ƙarin samfurin jini da aka karɓa daga mutanen da suke halarta aikinsu na gwajin jini.

sourceString: The 100 general practices currently undertaking annual influenza virology surveillance will be involved in the extended virological and serological surveillance.
targetString: Ayyukoki 100 na yau da kullun suna gudanar da aikin sa idon shekara na influenza virology za su kasance cikin aikin fadada tsarin binciken sa ido ta virologyl da na serological.

sourceString: (4) Collecting convalescent serum samples.
targetString: (4) tattara samfuran masu warkewa daga serum.

sourceString: We have the opportunity to escalate the data extraction to twice weekly if needed.
targetString: Muna da damar haɓakar hakar bayanan zuwa mako biyu idan an buƙata.

sourceString: Swabs and sera will be analyzed in PHE reference laboratories.
targetString: Za'a bincika Swabs da sera a cikin dakunan gwaje-gwaje na PHE.

sourceString: General practice clinical system providers have introduced an emergency new set of clinical codes to support COVID-19 surveillance.
targetString: Kwararrun masu ba da sabis na asibiti sun gabatar da sabon lamunin gaggawa na lambobin asibiti don tallafawa kulawar COVID-19.

sourceString: Additionally, practices participating in current virology surveillance are now taking samples for COVID-19 surveillance from low-risk patients presenting with LRTIs.
targetString: Bugu da ƙari, ayyukan da ke halartar aikin sa ido na virology yanzu suna ɗaukar samfurori don kulawa ta COVID-19 daga marasa lafiya masu karancin haɗari waɗanda ke gabatar da LRTIs.

sourceString: Within the first 2 weeks of setup of this surveillance, we have identified 3 cases: 1 through the new coding system, the other 2 through the extended virology sampling.
targetString: A tsakanin makonni 2 na farko na saitin wannan sa ido, mun gano mutane 3: 1 ta sabon tsarin lambar, sauran 2 ta hanyar samfurin gwajin barologi da aka fadada.

sourceString: We have rapidly converted the established national RCGP RSC influenza surveillance system into one that can test the effectiveness of the COVID-19 containment policy.
targetString: Munyi saurin canza tsarin RCGP RSC Tsarin kula da mura na kasa a cikin wanda zai iya gwada tasirin ƙa'idar kwantar da COVID-19.

sourceString: The extended surveillance has already seen the use of new codes with 3 cases reported.
targetString: Tsawaita aikin ya riga ya ga yin amfani da sabbin lambobin tare da rahoton 3.

sourceString: Rapid sharing of this protocol should enable scientific critique and shared learning.
targetString: Yin saurin raba wannan yarjejeniya ya kamata ya ba da damar yin amfani da ƙididdigar kimiyya da kuma ilmantarwa mai amfani.

sourceString: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) is a network of general practices (GPs) with a nationally representative population that provides pseudonymized data for weekly surveillance of infectious diseases.
targetString: Cibiyar Bincike da Kula da Kulawa da Kulawa da Kulawa (RCGP) na Kwalejin Sarauta na manyana kwararu(RSC) wata hanyar sadarwa ce ta gaba daya (GPs) tare da yawan wakilai a cikin kasar da ke ba da bayanan pseudonymized na sa ido kamuwa na mako-mako.

sourceString: The disease surveillance program is commissioned by Public Health England (PHE) and covers 37 infectious diseases, including influenza.
targetString: Hukumar Kiwon Lafiyar Ingila (PHE) ne ta zartar da tsarin sa ido kan cuta wanda ta kunshi cututtukar mai yaduwa 37, har da cutar mura.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC and PHE have an established collaboration of over 50 years in influenza and respiratory disease surveillance and are now in their 53rd season of surveillance and analysis.
targetString: RCGP RSC da PHE suna da haɗin gwiwar haɗin gwiwa na sama da shekaru 50 a cikin mura da kulawar cututtukan fata kuma yanzu suna cikin shekaru 53 na aikin safiyo da bincike.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC extracts pseudonymized data from a nationally representative sample of over 500 urban and nonurban GPs each week covering a population of over 4 million.
targetString: RCGP RSC ya fitar da bayanan pseudonymized da suka dace daga wakilan kasa baki daya sama da 500 GPs na birni da wadanda ba birrai kowane mako wanda ke kunshe da yawan mutane sama da miliyan 4.

sourceString: Data from these practices are reported online in a weekly return, which includes monitoring weekly rates of influenza-like illness (ILI) and other communicable and respiratory diseases in England.
targetString: Bayanai daga waɗannan al'amuran ana ba da rahoton su ta hanyar yanar gizo a cikin dawowar mako, wanda ya haɗa da saka idanu kan farashin mako-mako na cutar mura (ILI) da sauran cututtukan da ake magana a kai da cututtukan numfashi a Ingila.

sourceString: We also produce an annual report.
targetString: Muna kuma samar da rahoton shekara-shekara.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC data set includes all coded data and all prescribed items including vaccine exposure.
targetString: Saitin bayanan RCGP RSC ya ƙunshi duk lambobin da aka kayyade da duk abubuwan da aka tsara tare da fallasa maganin alurar rigakafi.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC conducts virology surveillance each influenza season, with 100 GPs participating in the 2019-2020 season (Figure 1).
targetString: RCGP RSC tana gudanar da aikin bincike na virology kowane lokacin mura, tare da 100 GPs suna cikin kakar 2019-2020 (Hoto 1).

sourceString: These virology sampling practices are also recruited to be nationally representative (Figure 1).
targetString: Ana kuma ɗaukar waɗannan samfuran virology su zama wakilin ƙasa (Siffa 1).

sourceString: GPs take nasopharyngeal swabs from persons showing acute respiratory illness within 7 days of the onset of symptoms.
targetString: GPs suna ɗaukar samfurin gwaji daga bayan hanci (nasopharyngeal swabs) daga mutanen da ke nuna kamuwa da ciwo hanyar numfashi a cikin kwanaki 7 na bayyanar cututtuka.

sourceString: Nasopharyngeal swabs are taken from children younger than 5 years showing symptoms of acute bronchitis or bronchiolitis.
targetString: Nasopharyngeal swabs ana ɗauka daga yara waɗanda shekarunsu ba su wuce 5 ba suna nuna alamun cutar mashako ko mashako.

sourceString: Additionally, nasopharyngeal samples are taken from anyone 5 years and older showing acute onset of ILI and respiratory synctial virus.
targetString: Bugu da ƙari, ana ɗaukar samfurori na nasopharyngeal daga duk wanda ke da shekaru 5 da haihuwa wanda ya nuna farkon farawar ILI da ƙwayar cuta ta numfashi.

sourceString: Swabs are tested at the PHE Respiratory Virus Unit for influenza to monitor positivity rates and circulating strains, as well as for measuring vaccine effectiveness.
targetString: An gwada Swabs a Sashin Kwayar cuta ta PHE don cutar mura don saka idanu kan yawan cututtukan da ke gudana, da kuma gwargwadon ingancin maganin.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC successfully conducted a pilot collecting serological samples from adults and linking them to a patient's medical records during the 2018-2019 influenza season.
targetString: RCGP RSC ta sami nasarar gudanar da wani matukin jirgi mai tattara samfuran serological daga manya kuma yana haɗa su zuwa bayanan likitan haƙuri yayin kakar mura ta 2018-2019.

sourceString: This pilot was in collaboration with the PHE Seroepidemiology Unit and added to the residual blood samples submitted to PHE by National Health Service (NHS) laboratories.
targetString: Wannan gwajin farko ya kasance tare da hadin gwiwar PHE Seroepidemiology Unit kuma an kara shi a cikin samfuran jini wanda aka mika wa PHE ta Cibiyar Kiwon Lafiya ta Kasa (NHS).

sourceString: Serology can provide important information about background population immunity, and sentinel networks can provide a mechanism for systematic data collection and linkage to medical records and health outcomes.
targetString: Serology na iya ba da mahimman bayanai game da rigakafin yawan asalin jama'a, kuma cibiyoyin sadarwar aika sakonni na iya samar da hanyoyin tattara bayanai na tsari da haɗin gwiwa ga bayanan likita da sakamakon kiwon lafiya.

sourceString: The serology pilot has demonstrated the ability of the network to collect serology samples in adults.
targetString: Jirgin serology ya nuna ikon cibiyar sadarwa don tara samfuran serology a cikin manya.

sourceString: With the COVID-19 outbreak, PHE and RCGP RSC have adapted existing influenza surveillance to monitor the spread of COVID-19 in the community, and this protocol sets out the basis for that collaboration.
targetString: Tare da barkewar COVID-19, PHE da RCGP RSC sun daidaita yanayin kulawar data kamu don lura da yaduwar COVID-19 a cikin alumma, kuma wannan yarjejeniya ta kafa tushen wannan haɗin gwiwar.

sourceString: The primary national strategy for COVID-19 infection is containment, with patients who are at high risk managed via the telephone help system NHS111 and the PHE health protection teams, but the RCGP RSC surveillance is entirely separate.
targetString: Tsarin dabarun farko na kasa da kasa game da kamuwa da COVID-19 shine ɗaukar hoto, tare da marasa lafiya waɗanda ke cikin haɗari mai yawa ta hanyar sarrafawa ta wayar tarho NHS111 da ƙungiyar kare lafiyar kiwon lafiya ta PHE, amma sa ido RCGP RSC ya kasance daban.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC, by extending its established work, will provide virological and serological surveillance to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community, and assess the effectiveness of the containment strategy.
targetString: RCGP RSC, ta hanyar fadada ayyukanta, za ta ba da kulawa ta virological da serological don saka idanu kan sauye-sauye da yanayin rarraba COVID-19 a cikin alumma, tare da tantance tasirin dabarun garkuwa.

sourceString: We would not be working in isolation on this research.
targetString: Ba za muyi aiki a ware ba a kan wannan binciken.

sourceString: We will share the protocol with UK colleagues and the I-MOVE consortium who have recently obtained EU Horizon 2020 funding from the stream “Advancing knowledge for the clinical and public health response to the novel coronavirus epidemic”.
targetString: Za mu raba wannan yarjejeniya tare da abokan aiki na Burtaniya da kuma kungiyar hadin gwiwar I-MOVE wadanda kwanan nan suka sami tallafin EU Horizon 2020 daga rafin “Inganta ilimi don martani na asibiti da kuma lafiyar jama'a game da annobar cutar coronavirus.”

sourceString: It is anticipated that great efficiencies in project management will result through this collaboration than that obtained from countries acting alone.
targetString: Ana tsammanin babban inganci a cikin aikin gudanarwa zai haifar da wannan haɗin gwiwar fiye da wadatar da aka samu daga ƙasashen da ke aiki kai kaɗai.

sourceString: The aim of this study is to identify whether there is undetected community transmission of COVID-19, estimate population susceptibility, and monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community.
targetString: Manufar wannan binciken ita ce gano ko akwai yaduwar cuta CoVID-19 cikin al'umma wanda ba a sani ba, kimanta kamuwar yawan jama'a, da sanya idon wucin gadi da kuma rarrabawa kamuwar COVID-19 a yankunan al'umma.

sourceString: The objectives of this study are as follows:
targetString: Manufofin wannan binciken kamar haka:

sourceString: To monitor the burden of suspected COVID-19 activity in the community through primary care surveillance and clinical coding of possible COVID-19 cases referred into the containment pathway
targetString: Don sa ido kan nauyin da ake zargi na aikin COVID-19 a cikin al'umma ta hanyar kulawa da kulawa ta farko da kuma ƙaddamar da asibiti na yiwuwar shari'oin COVID-19 da aka ambata a cikin hanyar ɓoye

sourceString: To provide virological evidence on the presence and extent of undetected community transmission of COVID-19 and monitor positivity rates among individuals presenting ILI or acute respiratory tract infections to primary care
targetString: Don samar da shaidar virological kan kasancewar yanayin rashin gano watsa cutar COVID-19 cikin al'umma da kuma lura da adadin kamuwa tsakanin mutane waɗanda ke gabatar da ILI ko tsanancin kamuwa da cutan hanyoyin numfashi zuwa farkon kulawa.

sourceString: To estimate baseline susceptibility to COVID-19 in the community and estimate both symptomatic and asymptomatic exposure rates in the population through seroprevalence monitoring
targetString: Don kimanta daidaitaccen tushe zuwa COVID-19 a cikin al'umma kuma ƙididdige masu alamuncututtuka da marasa alamu fallasa a cikin yawan jama'a ta hanyar seroprevalence saka idanu

sourceString: To pilot implementation of a scheme for collection of convalescent sera with antibody profiles among recovered cases of COVID-19 discharged to the community
targetString: Don aiwatar da wani tsari na tattara tarin kwayar cuta tare da bayanan tsofaffi tsakanin bayanan da aka samu na COVID-19 da aka sallama a cikin alumma

sourceString: We intend to capture the following.
targetString: Munyi nufin kama wadannan.

sourceString: Clinical workload related to reports of COVID-19 using the codes created to flag cases, those being assessed and where the infection is located are excluded (Figures 2-​-44)
targetString: Abun aikin asibiti wanda ya shafi rahotannin COVID-19 ta amfani da lambobin da aka kirkira don yiwa shari'ar tutar, wadanda ba'a tantance su ba kuma a inda ake samun kamuwa da cuta (Alƙalawa 2 -44)

sourceString: Foreign countries visited in the last 28 days
targetString: Kasashen waje wadanda aka ziyarta cikin kwanaki 28 da suka gabata

sourceString: Existing codes that may have utility (Tables 1-​-3).3).
targetString: Akwai lambobin da zasu kasance suna da amfani (Tebur 1--3) .3).

sourceString: Many GPs and primary care teams may not realize that important relevant data can be coded.
targetString: Yawancin GPs da ƙungiyoyin farkon kulawa ba sa iya gane cewa mahimman bayanai masu mahimmanci za a iya saka masu lamba.

sourceString: There is also the potential during any pandemic to monitor the effectiveness of any transmission control measures.
targetString: Hakanan akwai yuwuwar yayin kowace cutar don saka idanu kan tasirin kowane matakan sarrafa yaduwa.

sourceString: Reliable coding of letters and test results that will show an infection has become either confirmed or excluded
targetString: Amintaccen lamba na haruffa da sakamakon gwajin da zai nuna kamuwa da cuta ya zama an tabbatar ko an cire shi

sourceString: The methods will follow the approach used in the current influenza surveillance system and recent serology study, and includes five components: (1) primary care clinical surveillance; (2) virological surveillance; (3) population serological surveillance; (4) convalescent sera in cases; and (5) data curation.
targetString: Hanyoyin za su bi tsarin da aka yi amfani da shi a cikin tsarin sa ido na yau da binciken serology na kwanan nan, kuma ya haɗa da abubuwa guda biyar: (1) sa idon kulawar ta farko na asibiti; (2) sa ido kan ayyukan virology; (3) lura da yanayin yawan jama'a; (4) samun sauki daga cutar sera; da (5) daidaicin bayanai.

sourceString: The NHS uses the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms (SNOMED CT) system of coding, which is normally only updated twice annually.
targetString: NHS suna amfani da Tsarin lambar yanayi na Tsarin Kiraji (SNOMED CT), wanda ake sabuntawa sau biyu kawai a shekara.

sourceString: There was added complexity as some computerized medical record (CMR) suppliers use the Read coding systems (Read clinical terms version 3 – CTv3), which is no longer updated.
targetString: An kara rikicewa yayin da wasu keɓaɓɓen rakodin likitancin kwamfuta (CMR) ke ba su yi amfani da Karatun tsarin lamba (Karanta sharuɗɗan asibiti sigar na 3 - CTv3), wanda ba a sabuntawa ba.

sourceString: Additionally, there were no clinical codes to record COVID-19 in early February 2020.
targetString: Bugu da ƙari, babu lambobin asibiti don yin ajiyar COVID-19 a farkon Fabrairu 2020.

sourceString: Therefore, the two main GP system suppliers added the five terms shown in Table 4 as system-wide local codes.
targetString: Saboda haka, manyan masu samar da tsarin GP guda biyu sun kara sharuddan guda biyar da aka nuna a Tebur 4 matsayin mahimman ƙa'idodin gida.

sourceString: A UK emergency release of SNOMED CT concepts for COVID-19 was also subsequently made available across all CMR systems (Table 4).
targetString: Bayanin gaggawa na Burtaniya na SNOMED CT Concepts na COVID-19 shima daga baya an samar dashi a dukkan tsarin CMR (Table 4).

sourceString: The statistical methodology is in support of a policy approach to widespread disease outbreak, where so-called nonpharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) are used to respond to an emerging pandemic to produce disease suppression.
targetString: Tsarin ilimin kididdiga yana cikin goyon bayan tsarin dabarun kamuwa da barkewar cutar, inda ake amfani da abubuwan da ba na maganin cututtukan ba wato (nonpharmaceutical interventions) (NPIs) ana amfani da su domin amsar annoba da ke tasowa don samar da abin da zai daina cutar.

sourceString: This policy aims to reduce contact rates in the population and thereby reduce transmission of the virus.
targetString: Wannan manufar tana nufin rage yawan saduwa a cikin jama'a don haka rage watsa kwayar cutar.

sourceString: To implement this the UK government has recently articulated the desire to implement population self-isolation measures.
targetString: Don aiwatar da wannan, gwamnatin Burtaniya ta bayyana kwanan nan sha'awar aiwatar da matakan kebanta jama'a.

sourceString: By targeting the reproduction number (R) (the average number of secondary cases each case generates) and aiming to reduce the R to below 1, the policy seeks to reduce case numbers to low levels or (as seen in previous outbreaks with severe acute respiratory syndrome and Ebola) to eliminate human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Ta hanyar niyya lambar haifuwa (R) (matsakaicin adadin shari'oin sakandare kowane lamari yana haifar da) da nufin rage R zuwa ƙasa 1, manufofin suna neman rage lambobin yanayin zuwa ƙananan matakan ko (kamar yadda aka gani a cikin barkewar cutar ta baya tare da mummunan matsananciyar numfashi. ciwo da Ebola) don kawar da watsawar mutum-da-mutum.

sourceString: As the experience from the 2009 H1N1 pandemic has shown, NPIs can be a crucial component of pandemic mitigation.
targetString: Kamar yadda gogewa daga cutar H1N1 ta 2009 ya nuna, NPIs na iya zama mahimmancin rage ƙwayar cutar.

sourceString: Key to the focus of our study will be the estimation of peak cases in the population and continual monitoring by data collection and modelling the potential growth and emergence of subsequent peaks in new cases as social distancing measures are relaxed.
targetString: Mabuɗin abin da zai saɓa mana binciken zai zama ƙididdigar yawan lokuta a cikin alƙaluma da ci gaba da sanya ido ta hanyar tattara bayanai da kuma yin ƙima da haɓaka masu haɓaka da fitowar masu zuwa a cikin sababbin lamurra kamar yadda matakan walwala na zamantakewa ke walwala.

sourceString: There has already been publication of important disease epidemiological measures concerning the outbreak of COVID-19 in mainland China.
targetString: Ya zuwa yanzu an riga an fitar da mahimman matakai game da barkewar cututtukanr COVID-19 a cikin ƙasar Sin.

sourceString: A further fundamental measure in pandemic dynamics is the length of time from infection to when a person is infectious to others and the mean duration of infectiousness.
targetString: Matsakaicin mahimmancin ci gaba a cikin tasirin annobar ƙwayar cuta shine tsawon lokaci daga kamuwa da cuta har zuwa lokacin da mutum yake kamuwa da sauran mutane da kuma lokacin cutar.

sourceString: These factors, if estimated accurately, will give good predictions for the likely length of the pandemic, the final number of infected cases.
targetString: Wadannan abubuwan, idan an kiyasta su daidai, zasu bayar da tsinkaya mai kyau ga tsayin daka na cutar, lambar karshe ta kamuwa da cutar.

sourceString: We intend to apply approximate Bayesian inference (ABC) to (possibly spatially heterogeneous) Susceptible-Exposed- Infectious-Removed (SEIR) stochastic epidemic models.
targetString: Mun yi niyyar aiwatar da kimantar Bayesiyan inference (ABC) ga (yiwuwar spatially heterogneous) Mai saukin kamuwa-Bijira-Kamu da cuta-Cirewa stochastic epidemic model (SEIR).

sourceString: Such techniques are highly parallelizable and have been successfully applied to many fields including disease transmission modelling.
targetString: Irin waɗannan fasahohin suna da daidaituwa sosai kuma an sami nasarar amfani da su ga filaye da yawa ciki har da samfurin tallan cutar.

sourceString: They are particularly suited to situations where likelihood functions are absent and where more traditional approaches such as Markov chain Monte Carlo are impractical.
targetString: Sun fi dacewa sosai ga yanayin da yanayin rashin aiki yake kuma inda ƙarin hanyoyin gargajiya kamar Markov sarkar Monte Carlo ba su da fa'ida.

sourceString: Such an approach has been demonstrated to work effectively on the ASPREN surveillance data, a network of sentinel GPs and nurse practitioners who report deidentified information on ILIs and other conditions, where issues such as missing data and the need to model the observation process itself has been successfully addressed.
targetString: An nuna irin wannan tsarin don yin aiki yadda ya kamata kan bayanan sa ido na ASPREN, cibiyar sadarwar GPs da likitocin da ke ba da labarin ɓoyayyiyar bayanai game da ILIs da sauran yanayi, inda batutuwa kamar ɓatattun bayanai da kuma buƙatar yin kwaikwayon tsarin lura da kanta ya kasance. an yi nasarar magance shi.

sourceString: Furthermore, peaks in new cases have been estimated by distributional methods.
targetString: Bugu da ƙari, ƙididdigar mafi girma a cikin sababbin lokuta an kiyasta ta hanyoyin rarraba.

sourceString: Estimates of the parameters of the SEIR model are tractable on large data sets because of parallelizability, and these methods have been implemented in several R libraries; we intend to use the libraries ABSEIR (deposited on GitHub: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) and abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) to estimate epidemic measures on a weekly basis.
targetString: Kimantawar sigogin samfurin SEIR ana zazzage su akan manyan bayanan bayanai saboda daidaituwa, kuma an aiwatar da waɗannan hanyoyin a cikin ɗakunan karatu na R yawa; muna da niyyar amfani da ɗakunan karatu na ABSEIR (sanya a kan GitHub: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) da abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) don kimanta matakan cutar a kowace mako.

sourceString: Since we are fitting an SIR-epidemic model in the ABC routine, we anticipate that our results will be robust against weekly case data containing relatively small counts.

sourceString: Finally, in addition to the above methodology we will employ the Kaplan-Meier method with two outcomes (death and recovery) to estimate the case fatality ratio.

sourceString: Impact of the 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic on education

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic has affected educational systems worldwide, leading to the widespread closures of schools and universities.

sourceString: According to UNESCO monitoring, 188 countries have implemented nationwide closures and 5 have implemented local closures, impacting about 99.4%  of the world's student population.

sourceString: International Baccalaureate exams have also been cancelled.School closures impact not only students, teachers, and families, but have far-reaching economic and societal consequences.
targetString: Ba a kuma soke jarrabawar Baccalaureate ta kasa ba. Makarantar rufe makarantu ba kawai ɗalibai, malamai, da iyalai ba, har ma da sakamako mai ɗorewa na tattalin arziki da al'umma.

sourceString: School closures in response to COVID-19 have shed light on various social and economic issues, including student debt, digital learning, food insecurity, and homelessness, as well as access to childcare, health care, housing, internet, and disability services.
targetString: Rufe makarantu don mayar da martani ga COVID-19 sun ba da haske game da batutuwan zamantakewa da tattalin arziki daban-daban, ciki har da bashin ɗalibai, ilimin dijital, rashin abinci, da rashin matsuguni, har ma da samun damar kula da lafiyar yara, kiwon lafiya, gidaje, intanet, da sabis na kasasu.

sourceString: The impact was more severe for disadvantaged children and their families, causing interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems, and consequent economic cost to families who could not work.In response to school closures, UNESCO recommended the use of distance learning programmes and open educational applications and platforms that schools and teachers can use to reach learners remotely and limit the disruption of education.
targetString: Illar na da yawa tsanani akan yaran da ke da rauni da kuma iyalan su wanda hakan ya kawo tsaiko a lamarin karatu, kayan gina jiki, matsalolin jarirai, da ma tsadar tattalin arziki ga iyalan da ba sa aiki a sanadiyyar rufe makarantu, UNESCO ta shawarci yin amfani da koyarwa mai tazara da budaden manhajar ilimi da zaurukan karatu, da malamai da makarantu wanda akan iya amfani da su daga nesa don rege illar da ke fuskantar ilimin zamani.

sourceString: Efforts to stem the spread of COVID-19 through non-pharmaceutical interventions and preventive measures such as social-distancing and self-isolation have prompted the widespread closure of primary, secondary, and tertiary schooling in over 100 countries.Previous outbreaks of infectious diseases have prompted widespread school closings around the world, with varying levels of effectiveness.
targetString: Yunkurin dakile yaduwar cutar COVID-19 ta hanyar da wanda bata danganci magani ba kamar bayar da tazara tsakanin juna da zaman gida tayi sanadiyar rufe makarantun Firamare da Sekandare da manyan makarantu na kasashe fiye da 100. Barkewar annoba a baya tayi sanadiyar rufe makarantu da dama a kasashen duniya tare da tasirin ta a ko wani mataki.

sourceString: Mathematical modelling has shown that transmission of an outbreak may be delayed by closing schools.
targetString: Tsarin kididdigi ya nuna cewa yaduwar wata annoba na raguwa yayin da aka kulle makarantu.

sourceString: However, effectiveness depends on the contacts children maintain outside of school.
targetString: Bugu da kari tasirin ta ya danganta da yanayin huldar yara gabanin fita daga wajen koyon darasi.

sourceString: School closures may be effective when enacted promptly.

targetString: Idan rufewar makarantu ya makara kusancin daga zuwa wata cuta, ba su da tasiri kuma wataƙila ba su da wani tasiri ba.

sourceString: School closures were shown to reduce morbidity from the Asian flu by 90% during the 1957–58 outbreak, and up to 50% in controlling influenza in the US, 2004–2008.Multiple countries successfully slowed the spread of infection through school closures during the 2009 H1N1 Flu pandemic.

sourceString: School closures in the city of Oita, Japan, were found to have successfully decreased the number of infected students at the peak of infection; however closing schools was not found to have significantly decreased the total number of infected students.

sourceString: Mandatory school closures and other social distancing measures were associated with a 29% to 37% reduction in influenza transmission rates.

sourceString: Despite the overall success of closing schools, a study of school closures in Michigan found that "district level reactive school closures were ineffective."During the swine flu outbreak in 2009 in the UK, in an article titled "Closure of schools during an influenza pandemic" published in the Lancet Infectious Diseases, a group of epidemiologists endorsed the closure of schools in order to interrupt the course of the infection, slow further spread and buy time to research and produce a vaccine.

sourceString: Having studied previous influenza pandemics including the 1918 flu pandemic, the influenza pandemic of 1957 and the 1968 flu pandemic, they reported on the economic and workforce effect school closure would have, particularly with a large percentage of doctors and nurses being women, of whom half had children under the age of 16.
targetString: Bayan lura da annobar cutar shakar iska da suka barke a bayan ciki har da na 1918 da na 1957 da kuma 1968, rahoto akan tattalin arziki da sakamakon rashin aiki bayan rufe makarantu ya nuna cewa kaso mafi yawa cikin likitoci da masu jinyar mara sa lafiya mata ne inda kuma mafi yawancin su karbi haihuwar yara kasa da shekara 16.

sourceString: They also looked at the dynamics of the spread of influenza in France during French school holidays and noted that cases of flu dropped when schools closed and re-emerged when they re-opened.

sourceString: For schools and childcare facilities, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as cancelling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.

sourceString: School closures in response to the COVID-19 pandemic have shed a light on numerous issues affecting access to education, as well as broader socio-economic issues.

sourceString: As of March 12, more than 370 million children and youth are not attending school because of temporary or indefinite country wide school closures mandated by governments in an attempt to slow the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: A daidai ranar 12 ga watan Maris sama da yara da matasa Miliyan 370 suka daina zuwa makarantu sanadiyar matakin da gwamnatocin kasashe suka dauka na kulle makarantu duk cikin kokarin rage yaduwa COVID-19.

sourceString: As of 29 March, nearly 90% of the world's learners were impacted by closures.Even when school closures are temporary, it carries high social and economic costs.

sourceString: The disruptions they cause affect people across communities, but their impact is more severe for disadvantaged children and their families including interrupted learning, compromised nutrition, childcare problems and consequent economic cost to families who cannot work.

sourceString: UNESCO is sharing 10 recommendations during this period:
targetString: UNESCO tana raba shawarwari 10 a wannan lokacin:

sourceString: Examine the readiness and choose the most relevant tools: Decide on the use high-technology and low-technology solutions based on the reliability of local power supplies, internet connectivity, and digital skills of teachers and students.
targetString: Yi nazarin shirye-shirye kuma zaɓi kayan aikin da suka fi dacewa: Yanke shawara game da amfani da fasaha mai zurfi da ƙarancin fasahar da ta dogara da dogaro da wadatar wutar lantarki na gida, haɗin intanet, da ƙwarewar dijital na malamai da ɗalibai.

sourceString: This could range through integrated digital learning platforms, video lessons, MOOCs, to broadcasting through radios and TVs.
targetString: Ana iya sauya salon koyarwar ta hanyar fasahar koyarwa ta zamani tare da samun darusa ta bidiyo da manhaja dake baje kolin darusa ta na'urar intanet sa'anan ana iya watsa wa ta hanyar rediyo ko Telibijin.

sourceString: Ensure inclusion of the distance learning programmes: Implement measures to ensure that students including those with disabilities or from low-income backgrounds have access to distance learning programmes, if only a limited number of them have access to digital devices.
targetString: Tabbatar da haɗuwa da shirye-shiryen koyo daga nesa: Aiwatar da matakan tabbatar da cewa ɗalibai gami da waɗanda ke da nakasa ko daga ƙasashe masu ƙarancin kudin shiga suna da damar yin shirye-shiryen koyon nesa, idan iyakataccen adadin su ke da damar yin amfani da na'urorin dijital.

sourceString: Consider temporarily decentralising such devices from computer labs to families and support them with internet connectivity.
targetString: Ayi tunanin rage nauyin aikin na'urori zuwa ga iyali na kankanin lokaci tare da tallafa masu da Intanet.

sourceString: Protect data privacy and data security: Assess data security when uploading data or educational resources to web spaces, as well as when sharing them with other organisations or individuals.
targetString: A kare bayanan sirri da tabbatar da tsaron bayanai: ayi duba ga tsaron bayanai yayin wallafa bayani ko abubuwan koyi a yanar gizo tare da kuma kafin aikawa mai'aikatu ko kuma ma'abotan sadarwa.

sourceString: Ensure that the use of applications and platforms does not violate students' data privacy.
targetString: Tabbatar da cewa amfani da manahajar da dandamali ba ya keta sirrin bayanan ɗalibai ba.

sourceString: Prioritize solutions to address psychosocial challenges before teaching: Mobilize available tools to connect schools, parents, teachers, and students with each other.
targetString: Ba da fifiko kan hanyoyin magance matsalolin psychosocial kafin koyarwa: Shirya kayan aikin don haɗa makarantu, iyaye, malamai, da ɗalibai.

sourceString: Create communities to ensure regular human interactions, enable social caring measures, and address possible psychosocial challenges that students may face when they are isolated.
targetString: Gina al'umma domin tabbatar da kekkyawar mu'amala da gina kauna da kulawa. Yin haka na sauya kalubalen kwakwalwa da dalibai ke fuskanta yayin da suka kebe waje guda.

sourceString: Plan the study schedule of the distance learning programmes: Organise discussions with stakeholders to examine the possible duration of school closures and decide whether the distance learning programme should focus on teaching new knowledge or enhance students' knowledge of prior lessons.
targetString: Tsara ka'idar karatu ta hanyar matakin koyo daga gida. Shirya tattaunawa da jama'a domin yanke shawara na sauya darasi ko kuma yin gyara ga darusan baya ga dalibai yayin karbar darasi daga gida ta hanyar na'urar komfuta.

sourceString: Plan the schedule depending on the situation of the affected zones, level of studies, needs of students needs, and availability of parents.
targetString: Tsara jadawalin gwargwadon yanayin yankin da abin ya shafa, matakin karatu, bukatun ɗalibai, da kuma kasancewawar iyaye.

sourceString: Choose the appropriate learning methodologies based on the status of school closures and home-based quarantines.
targetString: Zabi hanyoyin dabarun koyo da suka dace dangane da matsayin rufe makarantu da kebewa cikin gida.

sourceString: Avoid learning methodologies that require face-to-face communication.
targetString: Ka kiyayi yanayin koyarwa da zai bukaci fuska da fuska wanjen sadarwa.

sourceString: Provide support to teachers and parents on the use of digital tools: Organise brief training or orientation sessions for teachers and parents as well, if monitoring and facilitation are needed.
targetString: Bayar da tallafi zuwa ga malamai da iyaye a wajen amfani da na'urar dijital: Shirya takaitaccen horo ko kuma tsarin gabatarwa domin malamai da iyaye su ma, idan ana bukatar kulawa da sauƙaƙewa.

sourceString: Help teachers to prepare the basic settings such as solutions to the use of internet data if they are required to provide live streaming of lessons.
targetString: Taimakawa malamai don shirya ingantattun saitunan kamar su mafita zuwa amfani da bayanan intanet idan an buƙatar su samar da darussan bidiyoyi kai tsaye a intanet.

sourceString: Blend appropriate approaches and limit the number of applications and platforms: Blend tools or media that are available for most students, both for synchronous communication and lessons, and for asynchronous learning.
targetString: Haɗa hanyoyin da suka dace da iyakance adadin aikace-aikace da dandamali: Kayan aiki na cakuda ko kafofin watsa labaru waɗanda ke akwai don yawancin ɗalibai, duka don sadarwa tare da darussan, da don koyon asynchronous.

sourceString: Avoid overloading students and parents by asking them to download and test too many applications or platforms.
targetString: Guji yawan ɗorarawa akan ɗalibai da iyayensu ta hanyar tambayar su sauke da jarraba aikace-aikace da yawa ko dandamali.

sourceString: Develop distance learning rules and monitor students' learning process: Define the rules with parents and students on distance learning.
targetString: Kirƙira dokokin koyo daga nesa da saka idanu kan tsarin ilmantarwa na ɗalibai: Bayyana ƙa'idodi ga iyaye da ɗalibai a kan ilimin nesa.

sourceString: Design formative questions, tests, or exercises to monitor closely students' learning process.
targetString: Tsara tambayoyi masu amfani, gwaji, motsa jiki don kulawa tsarin koyon dalibai.

sourceString: Try to use tools to support submission of students' feedback and avoid overloading parents by requesting them to scan and send students' feedback
targetString: Yi kokarin tallafawa wajen ganin taimakon dalibai, da batutuwan su kuma a rage dorawa iyaye nauyi na maida daliba ya je a duba shi sannan a turo shi raayi

sourceString: Define the duration of distance learning units based on students' self-regulation skills: Keep a coherent timing according to the level of the students' self-regulation and metacognitive abilities especially for livestreaming classes.
targetString: Ƙayyade tsawon raka'o'in karatun nesa dangane da dabarun sarrafawar-kan dalibai: Kiyaye daidaitaccen lokaci gwargwadon matakin sarrafawar-kan daliban da iya sanin hanyar tunani musamman ga ajin aikawar tarin bayanai a take.

sourceString: Preferably, the unit for primary school students should not be more than 20 minutes, and no longer than 40 minutes for secondary school students.

sourceString: Create communities and enhance connection: Create communities of teachers, parents, and school managers to address sense of loneliness or helplessness, facilitate sharing of experience and discussion on coping strategies when facing learning difficulties.
targetString: kirkira al'uma da kuma habbaka mazaunai: a kirkira alummar malamai, iyaye, mahukuntar makaranta don duba lamarin rasin taimako dama kadaici, a fadawa juna yadda ta kasance da ma yadda xa a iya shawo kan ta idan ana fuskantar rashin ganewa wajen koyo.

sourceString: NOW, THEREFORE, I, GAVIN NEWSOM, Governor of the State of California, in accordance with the authority vested in me by the State Constitution and statutes of the State of California, and in particular, Government Code sections 8567, 8627, and 8665 do hereby issue the following Order to become effective immediately:

sourceString: To protect public health, I as State Public Health Officer and Director of the California Department of Public Health order all individuals living in the State of California to stay home or at their place of residence except as needed to maintain continuity of operations of the federal critical infrastructure sectors, as outlined at https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.
targetString: Don kare lafiyar jama'a, ni a matsayina na Jami'in Kiwon Lafiyar Jama'a na Jiha kuma Daraktan Ma'aikatar Kiwon Lafiyar Jama'a na California ta ba da izinin duk mutanen da ke zaune a Jihar Kalifoniya su kasance a gida ko a inda suke zaune sai dai kamar yadda ake buƙata don ci gaba da ayyukan ci gaba na tarayya, bangarorin samar da ababen more rayuwa, kamar yadda aka bayyana a https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.

sourceString: The federal government has identified 16 critical infrastructure sectors whose assets, systems, and networks, whether physical or virtual, are considered so vital to the United States that their incapacitation or destruction would have a debilitating effect on security, economic security, public health or safety, or any combination thereof.
