sourceString: The disease is a type of coronavirus, the same family that includes SARS, MERS, and some varieties of the common cold.
targetString: Cutar wani nau'in coronavirus, dangi guda ɗaya ne wanda ya haɗa da SARS, MERS, da wasu nau'ikan sanyi na yau da kullun.

sourceString: It was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Hukumar Kiwon Lafiya ta Duniya (WHO) ta sanar da bullar cutar a ranar 11 ga watar Maris shekarar 2020.

sourceString: While much about COVID-19 is still unknown, preliminary data suggests that it is more virulent and contagious than the seasonal flu, and less virulent but more contagious than SARS and MERS.
targetString: Duk da yake abubuwa da yawa game da COVID-19 ba a sani ba har yanzu, bayanan farko sun ba da shawara cewa yana da kuzari da yaduwa fiye da mura na yau da kullun, kuma ƙasa da ƙwaƙwalwa amma mafi yaduwa fiye da SARS da MERS.

sourceString: Older people and those with underlying conditions are the most at risk of serious complications including death.
targetString: Tsofaffi da waɗanda ke da yanayin rashin ƙarfi suna cikin haɗarin mummunar rikice-rikice ciki har da mutuwa.

sourceString: Due to the spread of the disease, you are advised not to travel unless necessary, to avoid being infected, quarantined, or stranded by changing restrictions and cancelled flights.
targetString: saboda yaduwar cutar ba a shawarce ka da kayi tafiya ba sai in ta kama don kar ka kamu ko kebe ko makale don chanjin takunkumi ko sauke jirage.

sourceString: Avoid crowded places whenever possible.
targetString: Guji wuraren da cunkoson jama'a kowane lokacin da zai yiwu.

sourceString: This is not just to protect you, but also those you come in contact with.
targetString: Wannan bawai don kare ka bane, harma wadanda ka hadu dasu.

sourceString: As it happens, you probably aren't missing much by staying home, as many attractions around the world are closing their doors to avoid spreading the disease.
targetString: yaka faru bak ra sa ko mi zauna gida ba wani wajen kaool da ke bude a duniya da rage yaduwar.

sourceString: If you do need to travel, take precautions as you would for other infections: wash your hands frequently, avoid touching your face, cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and avoid contact with sick people.
targetString: in ba sai ka yi tafiya ba ka da maktakan kare kankan ka wanke hannu ka kyiyayi taba fuskar kaa da tari da atushawawa cikin tsafta kuma ka guji majinyanta.

sourceString: Before traveling, read up on the extensive and fast-changing array of travel restrictions that have been imposed around the world.
targetString: Kafin tafiya, karanta mafi girma da sauye-sauye na hana tafiye-tafiye da aka sanyawa a duniya.

sourceString: After travel, monitor your health and consider self-isolation for two weeks to avoid transmitting the disease to others.
targetString: Bayan tafiya, kka kula da lafiyar ka da kuma kebe kan ka ma tsawon makwanni biyu don kar ka yada wa wasu cutar.

sourceString: Transportation from long-distance passenger flights to local buses has been curtailed or completely shut down in many countries due to low demand or government orders.
targetString: An dakatar da jigilar pasinja zuwa nesa na jiragen saman fasinja zuwa tashar motoci na gida zuwa biranen kasashen da dama saboda karancin bukatun ko kuma umarnin gwamnati.

sourceString: Many international and regional borders are closed.
targetString: An rufe iyakokin kasashen duniya da yankuna da yawa.

sourceString: If you are away from home, and especially if you are in another country, consider returning home as soon as possible; this may get even more difficult as restrictions continue to change.
targetString: Idan ba ku da gida, kuma musamman idan kuna cikin wata ƙasa, yi la'akari da komawa gida da wuri-wuri; wannan na iya samun mawuyacin wahala yayin da hane-hane ke ci gaba da canzawa.

sourceString: In some cases it may simply not be possible, even if you're healthy and meet the legal requirements for entry.
targetString: A wasu halayen ba zai yuwu ba, koda kuwa kuna lafiya kuma kun cika ka'idodin doka don shigowa.

sourceString: If you can't find a way back to your country, contact your nearest embassy or consulate for assistance.
targetString: idan baka san hanyar kasar ku ba ka nemi offishin jakadanci ko kwansul don neman dauki.

sourceString: They may be able to organize an evacuation, identify non-regularly scheduled flights, or give you an emergency loan to pay for transport.
targetString: Za a iya tsara kwashewar, a gane jiragen da basu fiya zirga-zirga ba ko so baka bashin da za ka biyan kudin tafiyar.

sourceString: In case they can't, make preparations in case you need to stay where you are for an extended period.
targetString: Idan ba za su iya ba, ku shirya shirye-shiryen idan kuna buƙatar tsayawa a inda kuka kasance na wani tsawan lokaci.

sourceString: If you do find a way back home, be prepared that it may be expensive, inconvenient, and have unusual restrictions (such as no checked baggage).
targetString: Idan ka sami hanyar dawowa gida, kasance cikin shiri cewa yana iya zama mai tsada, mai wuya, kuma yana da hane-hane na yau da kullun (kamar babu kaya da aka bincika).

sourceString: As of early April 2020, the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 is approaching one million.
targetString: A fakon Afrillu 2020 majinyata wanda suka kamu da COVID-19 sun kai miliyan daya.

sourceString: Though the disease started in mainland China, it has spread around the world and China has fewer confirmed cases and deaths than several other countries.
targetString: Ko da yake cutar ta fara a yankin China, amma ta yadu a duniya kuma China ba ta tabbatar da kamuwa da cutar da sauran kasashe da dama ba.

sourceString: Europe is the new epicenter of the pandemic.
targetString: Turai ita ce sabon cibiyar cutar tashin hankali.

sourceString: All but a handful of countries have reported at least one case, with the highest numbers of reported cases in the United States, Spain, Italy, Germany, France, mainland China, Iran, and the United Kingdom.
targetString: ko ina banda wasu kasashe kalilan suka yi rahoton koda mutum daya da kasashe da cutar tafi yawa kamar su amurka, spain italy, germany farasa, kasan tsuburin china, iran da ma ingila.

sourceString: Local transmission is established in many countries in all major inhabited regions of the world except some Pacific island nations.
targetString: Hada hadar coikin gida a ko wani yanki da ma kasa za su tsammaci pacific island nations.

sourceString: (See updates from the WHO.)
targetString: kalli karin jawabi daga WHO.)

sourceString: The full extent of the spread is uncertain, due in part to limited testing.
targetString: Cikakken yaduwar ba ta da tabbas, saboda karanci wani sashi na gwaji.

sourceString: Many countries are experiencing a severe shortage of test kits, and the authorities have not been able to test everybody who is at high risk, so the real number of cases is probably much higher than the official one.
targetString: Yawancin kasashe suna fuskantar matsanancin karancin kayan gwaji, kuma hukumomi ba su iya gwada duk wanda ke cikin hadarin gaske ba, don haka adadin wadanda suka kai kara ya fi na hukuma girma.

sourceString: Countries also differ in their testing and reporting practices, so comparisons of the number of reported cases do not tell the full story of how the epidemic has progressed in different areas.
targetString: Kasashe suma sun banbanta a gwajinsu da yadda ake gabatar da rahoto, don haka kwatankwacin adadin wadanda aka ruwaito ba su bayar da cikakken labarin yadda cutar ta bulla a yankuna daban-daban ba.

sourceString: The virus is transmitted through respiratory droplets and through objects.
targetString: Kwayan cutar na yaduwa ta ɗigaggan hanyar numfashi da wasu ababe.

sourceString: The coronavirus is a relatively large virus, meaning it is not truly airborne: it will settle down in respiratory droplets.
targetString: Coronavirus babban cuta ne mai kusanci, ma'ana ba iska ne da gaske ba: zai zauna cikin saukowar numfashi.

sourceString: Staying two metres (six feet) away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.
targetString: Kasancewa mita biyu (ƙafa shida) daga sauran mutane yawancin lokaci ya isa ya hana yaduwaa ta wannan hanyar.

sourceString: Transmission from objects can happen, for example, if someone sneezes, touches a doorknob, and then other people touch the doorknob and then touch their faces.
targetString: yaduwa daga kayaki na iya faruwa, alal misali inda wani yayi atishawa, ya taba mabudin kofa sana'ana wasu suka taba wannan mabudi kuma suka taba furkar su.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours and on plastic for up to 3 days.
targetString: Kwayar cutar SARS-CoV-2 na iya kasancewa akan kwali har zuwa awanni 24 sannan akan filastik har tsawon kwanaki 3.

sourceString: Transmission via the fecal–oral route may also be possible.
targetString: Yaduwa ta hanyar kashil–baki na iya yiwuwa

sourceString: Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms, though to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Shaida ta nuna cewa COVID-19 yana da kwayar cutar koda ba tare da alamu ba, kodayake har yanzu ana binciken shi.

sourceString: Common symptoms include a fever, dry cough, and fatigue.
targetString: Alamun yau da kullun sun haɗa da zazzabi, bushe tari, da gajiya.

sourceString: Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath, a sore throat, headache, muscle pain, or sputum production.
targetString: Sauran kananan alamun rashin lafiya sun hada da karancin numfashi, ciwon makogwaro, ciwon kai, ciwon wuya, ko samarwar maniyyi.

sourceString: Some patients have very mild symptoms, similar to a cold.
targetString: Wasu marasa lafiya suna da alamu masu laushi, masu kama da mura.

sourceString: Serious complications include pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, and multi-organ failure leading to disability or death.
targetString: Matsanancin rikice-rikice sun haɗa da ciwon huhu, ciwo mai ratsa jiki, da gazawar jiki da dama da ke haifar da nakasa ko mutuwa.

sourceString: About 80% of infections result in mild symptoms, while the remaining may result in hospitalization.
targetString: Kimanin kashi 80% na cututtukan cututtuka suna haifar da bayyanar cututtuka, yayin da sauran na iya haifar da asibiti.

sourceString: Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals, most of whom are elderly with underlying health conditions.
targetString: yawan matsanancin masu cutar an yi kimani su akan kaso 1-3% na mutane wanda mafi rinjaye dattawa ne da masu raunin lafiya.

sourceString: The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70 but significantly lower for those under 40.
targetString: Yawan mace-macen yana da matukar girma ga wadanda shekarunsu ya wuce 70 ba amma ya ragu sosai ga wadanda shekarun su basu wuce 40 ba.

sourceString: Those most at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications are the elderly and those with weakened immune systems or underlying health conditions like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer.
targetString: wanda suka fi kowa fuskantar barazanar cutar COVID-19 da ma hadarin ta su ne wnda suka manyanta da kuma wanda basu da garkuwan jiki mai kwari kamar masu ciwon zuciya, sukari, hawan jini., matsalar huh, da ma ciwon daji.

sourceString: Not many cases are reported in children and most of these are mild or moderate, though a significant fraction do get pneumonia.
targetString: Ba a bada rahoton kamu da cutar ba a cikin yara ba kuma yawancin su kadan ne dan daidai, ko da yake yawancin kashin na samun nimoniya.

sourceString: Occupationally, health care workers have higher risk compared to others with clusters of disease among workers and in health care settings.
targetString: A lokaci-lokaci, ma'aikatan kiwon lafiya suna da haɗarin mafi girma idan aka kwatanta da wasu tare da gungu na cuta tsakanin ma'aikatan kuma a cikin tsarin kula da lafiya.

sourceString: The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms (incubation period) is typically between 2 and 14 days, though there has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure.
targetString: Tsakani kamuwa da cuta da bayyanan alamar cutan (lokacin girma) na tsakanin kwana 2 da 14, amma akwai sanin kamuwa da cutar guda daya a China inda alamar kamuwa ke fitowa kwanaki 27 bayan an kamu da cutar.

sourceString: As of February 2020, the period of infectiousness is unknown, but is likely most significant when people are symptomatic.
targetString: a watan faburairi 2020 lokacin ba a san yawan yaduwar ba amman yakan bayana idan mutate na da alamonin.

sourceString: There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms, although to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Akwai tabbacin yaduwar daga mutane marasa alamu, ko da yake ta wace hanya ake kan bincika.

sourceString: It is unclear whether it is possible to be reinfected with the virus after recovering from it the first time around.
targetString: Ba a sani ba ko yana yiwuwa a sake kamuwa da ƙwayar bayan an murmure daga ita a karon farko.

sourceString: Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear, but there is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients.
targetString: Alamun dogon illa ga mutanen da suka warke bai bayyana ba, amman akwai tabbas na rage karfin huhu a wasu wanda suka warke.

sourceString: Testing for the virus usually consists of a swab inserted through the nose or a throat swab which is analysed in a laboratory for the virus.
targetString: Gwajin cutar da kwayar cutar yawanci tana kunshe da swab da aka shigar ta hanci ko makogwaron wanda aka bincika shi a ɗakin bincike na ƙwayar.

sourceString: The current "gold standard" test involves extracting the genetic material from the sample and analysing it for known genetic markers of the virus.
targetString: Gwajin "ma'aunin zinare" na yanzu ya ƙunshi cire kayan kwayoyin halitta daga samfurin da kuma bincika shi don alamun cutar da aka sani.

sourceString: There is no established test assessing for the virus or antibodies in the blood, although tests are being developed.
targetString: Babu wani ingantaccen gwajin da aka tantance game da kwayar cutar ko rigakafi a cikin jini, kodayake ana ci gaba da gwaje-gwaje.

sourceString: There is no test to establish immunity to the virus.
targetString: ba bu wani gwajin kawo garkuwa daga cutar.

sourceString: Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel unnecessarily amid the pandemic.
targetString: Yawancin gwamnatoci a duniya sun shawarci 'yan kasarsu da kada su yi tafiya wanda bai cancanta ba a tsakiyar cutar.

sourceString: Lots of airlines and package holidays are making it easy for you by waiving cancellation and change fees.
targetString: mafiya wan jirage na bada daman soke htu ko chaja farashin .

sourceString: Particularly avoid cruise ship travel.
targetString: musamman ka kiyayi tafiya a kwale-kwale.

sourceString: Older travelers and those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk, such as long plane flights, visits to crowded places, and especially cruises, even outside of severely affected areas.
targetString: Tsofaffi matafiya da waɗanda ke da yanayin rashin lafiya suna cikin haɗari sosai kuma ya kamata su guji balaguron da zai jefa su cikin haɗari, kamar jiragen sama na dogon zango, ziyarar wuraren cunkoso, kuma musamman titin jirgin ruwa, har ma a wajen wuraren da cutar ta tsananta.

sourceString: In affected areas, most experts recommend a practice known as social distancing.
targetString: A cikin wuraren da abin ya shafa, yawancin masana suna ba da shawarar aikin da aka sani da nisantar da jama'a.

sourceString: This means minimising contact with others by keeping a distance of six feet or two meters from them and avoiding gathering together in groups.
targetString: wannan na nufin rafe muammala da wasu tafre da ba da tazara na kafa shida daga su dama gujewa taruka a kungiyya.

sourceString: Some areas permit small groups; others prohibit all group gatherings.
targetString: wasu wuraren na barin kananan taruka wasu ko ba sa yarda ko ma wani iri ne.

sourceString: Measures you are encouraged to take include working from home whenever possible, avoiding crowds and avoiding leaving your home unless absolutely necessary.
targetString: matakan da ake so ka dauka ciki harda aiki daga gida inda hali, chunkoso da ma barin giganka zuwa anguwa sai in ta kama.

sourceString: If you must go out, try to stay at least 2 meters (6 feet) away from other people.
targetString: Idan dole ne ka fita, yi ƙoƙarin nisanci aƙalla mita 2 (ƙafa 6) daga wasu mutanen.

sourceString: In many places these measures are required.
targetString: A wurare da yawa ana buƙatar waɗannan matakan.

sourceString: Follow hygiene practices like for flu prevention.
targetString: Bi ayyukan tsafta kamar na kariyar daga mura.

sourceString: Frequently wash your hands with soap and warm water, and then dry your hands on a clean towel.
targetString: Wanke hannayen kullum da sabulu da dumamen ruwa, sa ku busar da hannayen akan tsabtacen tawul.

sourceString: As coronaviruses are enveloped viruses, washing your hands with soap kills the virus by disrupting the mostly fat-based viral envelope.
targetString: kamar yadda cutar corona ke nade wasu cuttutuka, wanke hannu da sabulu na kashe kwayar cutar ta hanyan kashe maikon cutar da ke nede da ita.

sourceString: Effective hand washing requires rubbing your hands for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Wanke hannu na inganci na buƙatar shafa hannun ka aƙalla sekan 20.

sourceString: Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin (so don't skip that step, and don't share towels).
targetString: Busarwa da wankeke hannayen ku yana cire wasu kwayoyin cutar daga fata (don haka kar ku tsallake wancan matakin, kuma kada ku rarraba tawul).

sourceString: If soap and water are not available, then use a >60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
targetString: In Babu Ruwa da Sabulu, To Ayi Amfani Da >60% man tsaftace hanu mai sinadarin alcohol.

sourceString: Alcohol is a quick germ-killer, but it's not quite instant, so this still requires the same 20 seconds of rubbing your hands together, making sure that every single scrap of skin gets wet, and then you have to wait about another minute, for the alcohol to completely dry.
targetString: Man mai sinadarin alcohol na kashe kwaro sosai, amma ba yanzu-yanzu ba ne, sabo da haka yana buƙatar sakan 20 na shafa hannuwan ku tare, tabbatar da cewa kowane yanki na fata ya zama da danshi, sannan kuma dole ne ku jira kamar minti ɗaya, don man ya bushe gaba ɗaya.

sourceString: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with your hands.
targetString: Guji taɓa idanunku, hanci da bakinku da hannuwan ku.

sourceString: Most people touch their faces every few minutes, all day long.
targetString: Mafi yawan mutane suna taɓa fuskokinsu kowane ɗan mintuna, a tsawon yini.

sourceString: Try to do this less, and try to wash your hands before touching your face.
targetString: yi kokari ka rage wannan ka rinka wanke hannuk ka kafin taba fuskar ka.

sourceString: Also, try to avoid touching surfaces you don't have to touch in the first place, at least with your bare hands.
targetString: Hakanan, yi ƙoƙarin guji taɓa abubuwan da ba lallai ne ku taɓa da fari ba, aƙalla da hannayen ku.

sourceString: Cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and then immediately throw away the tissue and wash your hands.
targetString: yi tari ko atishwa a gwiwar hannun ka ko da takardar tsafta sanan ka jefar da wuri ka kuma wanke hanun ka.

sourceString: Don't stand or sit near people who might be sick.
targetString: Kar ka tasaya ko zauna kusa da wanda kan iya zama da rashin lafiya.

sourceString: Stay at least one meter – and ideally two meters (six feet) – away.
targetString: Bada tazara mita daya – ko da kyau mita shida nesan (kafa shida).

sourceString: As a quick way to eyeball this distance, imagine that you and the other person both reached your hands towards each other.
targetString: A matsayin hanzari don ka ƙalon na wannan nisan, ka ɗauka cewa kai da ɗayan biyun kun isa hannayenku ga juna.

sourceString: Could you touch the other person's hand without taking a step towards that person?
targetString: Shin za ka iya taɓa hannun wancan ba tare da ka ɗauki mataki a kan mutumin ba?

sourceString: If the answer is yes, then you're too close.
targetString: Idan amsar eh ce to kana kusa

sourceString: Clean objects and surfaces that a lot of people touch, such as doorknobs, phones, and television remotes with regular household cleaner.
targetString: goge abubuwan da mutane sukafi ta'amuli da kamar hanun kofa, wayar tarho, akwatin talabijin da abun goge-goge na gida.

sourceString: Disinfect the surfaces with a suitable disinfectant, such as diluted household bleach.
targetString: Ka lalata farfajiya ta dace da maganin kashe maye, kamar gurɓataccen ruwan gida.

sourceString: Stay home when you are sick, and avoid contact with other people until your symptoms are gone.
targetString: Ka zauna gida in baka da lafiya kuma kar kayi muammilla da mutane har sai alamun sun tafi.

sourceString: Do not share personal items that come into contact with saliva, such as toothbrushes, eating utensils, drinks, water bottles, and towels.
targetString: Kada ku raba abubuwa na sirri waɗanda suka sami saduwa da miyau, kamar su abin goge hakora, kayan cin abinci, abubuwan sha, kwalban ruwa, da tawul.

sourceString: The practice of serving yourself from a common plate with your own chopsticks, common in China, should be avoided.
targetString: Ya kamata a nisantar da al'adar bautar da kanku daga farantin gama gari tare da keɓaɓɓun sara, a cikin China.

sourceString: Greet people without touching them.
targetString: Gaishe mutane ba tare da an taɓa su ba.

sourceString: Avoid hugs, kisses, handshakes, fist bumps, and any other contact.
targetString: Guji runguma, sumba, musafiha, dunkulallen hannu da hannu, da duk wasu abokan hulɗa.

sourceString: If it's impossible to avoid contact, then wash your hands both before and after.
targetString: Idan ba zai yiwu ku guji huldawa ba, to ku wanke hannuwan ku biyu kafin da bayan.

sourceString: It won't protect you from the coronavirus, but it will partially protect you from the flu, which remains a greater risk than COVID-19 in many areas.
targetString: ba zai kare ka daga kamuwa da corona ba amman zai dan kare ka daga sanyi, wanda ke da hadarin samar da covid-19 a wurare da dama.

sourceString: This also saves you from unnecessary worry if you get the flu and think it might be the coronavirus.
targetString: Wannan shi ma na ceton ku daga banzan damuwa kuma tunanin cewa ya kan iya zaman coronavirus.

sourceString: If you are elderly or otherwise in a high-risk group and can be vaccinated for pneumonia, get that vaccination.
targetString: in ka girma ko koma kana daga ciki mafi hadarin jamuwa da cutar ka iya yin riga kafin sanyi, je ka samu rigakafin.

sourceString: It won't protect you from viral pneumonia from COVID-19, but some COVID-19 patients have died of bacterial pneumonia that attacked their weakened lungs, so a pneumonia vaccination could save your life.
targetString: Hakan ba zai kare ka daga cutar huhu daga COVID-19 ba, amma wasu marasa lafiyar COVID-19 sun mutu sakamakon kwayar cutar da ta mamaye huhunsu da suka raunana, don haka allurar rigakefir cutar huhu na iya ceton ranka.

sourceString: Wearing masks is recommended for those who are suspected of carrying of disease and those who are in close contact with those infected.
targetString: sanya takunkumin fuska ake bukata da ma wanda ake zargin suna dauke da ita da ma masu alakar kusa da wanda ke auke da ita.

sourceString: For those who are asymptomatic, the WHO does not recommend masks, though some national governments do.
targetString: Ga waɗanda ke babu alamun cuta, WHO ba ta bayar da shawarar rufe fuska ba, kodayake wasu gwamnatocin ƙasa suna yi.

sourceString: Wearing a mask of some kind is required in some countries and cities in an effort to reduce community transmission.
targetString: Saka Kariyar Fuska Na Wani Iri Ya Zama Dole Ne A Wasu Kasashe Da Biranen Don ƙoƙari Rage Yaduwar Cutar Cikin Al'Umma..

sourceString: There are worldwide shortages of surgical masks.
targetString: Akwai karancin abin Sanya Kariyar Fuska na asibiti a duniya.

sourceString: If you do wear a mask, make sure to use it correctly.
targetString: Idan ka sanya abin rufe fuska, tabbatar da amfani dashi daidai.

sourceString: The mask should cover your nose and mouth and fit without gaps.
targetString: Kariyar ta rufe maka hanci da baki cif-cif ba tare da tazara ba.

sourceString: Wash your hands before putting on the mask and avoid touching the mask while wearing it.
targetString: wanke hannu kafi ka daura kariyar fuska kuma a guji taba kariyar idan an sanya.

sourceString: If you do touch it, wash your hands immediately afterwards.
targetString: idan ka taba wanke hannuka cikin gaggawa.

sourceString: When the mask becomes damp, discard and replace it.
targetString: idan kariyar ta jike a cire a yar a sake wani.

sourceString: Remove it from the back, throw it away, and then wash your hands.
targetString: Cire shi daga baya, yar da shi, kuma wanke hannun ku.

sourceString: Remember that masks are not a substitute for good hygiene: continue to wash your hands frequently.
targetString: Ka tuna cewa masks ba zai maye gurbin mai tsafta ba: ci gaba da wanke hannayenka akai-akai.

sourceString: Don't stock up on masks if you don't need them.
targetString: Kada ku ajiye abin rufe fuska idan ba ku bukatar su.

sourceString: Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.

sourceString: Emergency assistance should still be available, though it's possible you may have to contact a further-away consulate if your local one has shut down.

sourceString: If you have been stranded due to the pandemic, your nearest consulate may be able to help you find a flight home, arrange an emergency loan so you can buy a ticket, or provide an emergency passport.

sourceString: Ordinary consular services such as visa and passport processing may be suspended or restricted to urgent need, depending on the location and the consulate.

sourceString: Although some people call the disease "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Wuhan disease", or "Chinese virus", the use of these terms is considered racist in China and by many people of Chinese origin.

sourceString: It is still common to refer the disease as "Wuhan pneumonia" or "Chinese virus" in places like Hong Kong and Taiwan.

sourceString: To be safe, use location-neutral terms when referring to the disease, such as "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", or just "the virus" or "the pandemic".

sourceString: Particularly in developing countries where law enforcement are poorly trained, enforcement of curfew, lockdown or stay-at-home orders are often brutal, often using forces not proportionate against crowds.
targetString: Musamman a cikin ƙasashe masu tasowa inda ake horar da tilasta bin doka da oda, aiwatar da dokar hana fita, kullewa ko umarni a gida-gida yawanci azzalumi ne, yawancin lokuta amfani da karfi ba sa dace da taron jama'a.

sourceString: Comply with these orders, and avoid crowds in public.
targetString: Bi waɗannan umarni, kuma ku guji taron jama'a.

sourceString: As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, xenophobia has risen in many countries, primarily but not exclusively targeting people perceived to be Chinese.
targetString: Sakamakon cutar sankara na coronavirus, 'yan ƙabilanci sun tashi a ƙasashe da yawa, da farko amma ban da niyya kawai ga mutanen da aka sani cewa su Sinawa ne.

sourceString: There has been a worldwide spike in racist incidents targeting people of East Asian origin, including in major cities such as New York, London and San Francisco.
targetString: An samu barkewar kabilaci wanda ke kai wa mutanen gabashin asia hari a birnin newyork landan da san francisco.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, Sinophobia, which was already high to begin with, has intensified as a result of the pandemic, with the result that many shops and restaurants are now denying service to mainland Chinese customers and banning Mandarin speakers from their premises (with the exception of Taiwanese).
targetString: A Hong Kong, Sinophobia, wanda ke cikin tashin farko sun tsananta a sakamakon annobar wanda ya haifar da shaguna da gidajen abinci da dama su ka dena saida kaya ga masu cinikin su yan china da ma hana masu yara mandarin zuwa kewayen su amman ban da taiwanese.

sourceString: Levels of xenophobia have also risen in East Asia, with some restaurants and other businesses in Japan and China refusing service to foreign customers.
targetString: yawan kabilanci ya tashi aq gabashin asis da ma wasu gidajern abinci a choina da japan dsa ayukan baki.

sourceString: In China, there have been incidents of foreigners being refused rooms by hotel staff, and foreign residents, particularly black people, being kicked out of their apartments on short notice by their landlords.
targetString: A China, akwai lokutan da 'yan otal din suka hana barorin' yan kasashen waje dakunan baƙi, kuma mazauna kasashen waje musamman bakar fata, ana fitar da su daga gidajensu ba tare da bata lokaci ba.

sourceString: Sources for further information on the coronavirus outbreak include:
targetString: Tushen don ƙarin bayani game da yaduwar coronavirus sun haɗa da:

targetString: Kungiyar Kula da Kariya daga Cuta na Turai wato European Center for Diseas Prvention and Control (sabuntawa na yau da kullum)

targetString: gwamnatin ingila - shawara ga matafiya daga offishin waje dana kasashen renon ingila.

sourceString: An online map and dashboard from the John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering with live updates
targetString: Taswirar kan layi da dashboard daga Cibiyar Jami'ar John Hopkins don Kimiyya na Tsarin Kayan Injiniyawa tare da sabuntawar rayuwa

sourceString: Partial lists of entry restrictions from IATA and The New York Times
targetString: Jerin sunayen wadanda aka ƙuntata shigar su daga IATA da New York Times.

sourceString: A variety of misinformation and conspiracy theories about the virus are being promoted online and even by some government officials, so be careful which sources you check for information.
targetString: yawan jita-jita da labarai marasa kai ake rabawa harda maaikatan gwamnati sai kayi hankali da tushen labarin ka.

sourceString: Ensure that all information and advice you receive has been backed by reputable doctors and scientists.
targetString: Tabbatar da dukkan shawarwari da bayanin da ka samu na da tabbabcin masu fasaha da likitoci.

sourceString: In a crisis, it's natural to want to keep following the latest updates, but it may be better for your mental health to moderate the amount of news that you look at, and stick to reliable news sources.
targetString: A cikin matsala, dabi'a ce mutum yaci gaba da bibiyar sabbin abubuwanda suka sabunta, amma yana iya zama mafi kyawu ga lafiyar hankalin ku dan rage yawan labaran da kuke kallo, kuma ku jingine hanyoyin samun labarai.

sourceString: If you normally watch the news twice per day then stick to this schedule and do something else, rather than having the 24-hour news on continuously.
targetString: Idan yawanci kuna kallon labarai sau biyu a rana to sai ku tsaya kan wannan jadawalin ku kuma yi wani abu, maimakon samun labarai na sa'oi lokaci 24 a ci gaba.

sourceString: b'Bat SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), also sometimes called SARS-like coronavirus WIV1, is a strain of Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) isolated from Chinese rufous horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus sinicus).
targetString: b'Bat SARS-kamar coronavirus WIV1 (Batir SL-CoV-WIV1), wanda ake kira kamanin-SARS coronavirus WIV1, wata damuwa ce cutar hanyoyin numfashi mai tsanani mai dangantakar cutar coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) an ware daga jemagen rufous horseshoe Sinawa (Rhinolophus sinicus).

sourceString: Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
targetString: Kamar kowane coronaviruses, budurwai sun ƙunshi kadara-guda tabataccen-hankali RNA wanda aka sanya a cikin ambulaf.

sourceString: The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Binciken ya tabbatar da cewa jemagu sune tafkin dabi'a na SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
targetString: Nazarin ilimin halittar dabbobi wato Phylogenetic analysis ya nuna yiwuwar watsa kwayar cutar SARS kai tsaye daga jemagu ga mutane ba tare da civets na kasar Sin ba, kamar yadda aka yi imani a baya.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: b'COVID-19 haɓaka magunguna shine aiwatar da bincike don haɓaka rigakafin rigakafi ko magani na warkewa wanda zai iya rage zafin cutar coronavirus a shekara 2019-20 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.
targetString: Dandalin Rikodin Gwajin Magungunan Asibiti ta Duniya wato International Clinical Trials Registry Platform na WHO sun rikodin biciken asibiti guda 536 haɓaka hanyoyin jinya ta kwantar da hankali bayan kamuwa da cuta COVID-19, tare da tarin ƙwayoyin rigakafin ƙwayar cuta don magance wasu cututtuka a ƙarƙashin binciken asibiti don sake aiki da su.

sourceString: In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: A watan Maris, WHO ta ƙaddamar da "Gwajin HADIN KAI" a cikin ƙasashe 10, rajista dubban mutane da suka kamu da COVID-19 don samun tasirin jinyan ƙariya daga kwayan cuta guda huɗu da ke samuwa tare da alkawarin ingantacen aiki.

sourceString: A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.
targetString: An kafa tsarin kwalliya, tsari mai zurfi a cikin Afrilu 2020 don bin diddigin ci gaban gwajin asibiti don rajistar maganin COVID-19 da kuma 'yan takarar maganin warkewa. Alurar rigakafi da haɓaka magunguna tsari ne da yawa, galibi yana buƙatar fiye da shekaru biyar don tabbatar da lafiya da kuma ingancin sabon mahadi.

sourceString: Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
targetString: Haɓaka magunguna shine aiwatar da sabon rigakafin cutar cututtukan ƙwayar cuta ko magani na warkewa zuwa kasuwa da zarar an gano tushen gubar ta hanyar gano magunguna.

sourceString: It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.
targetString: yana hade ha gwajin dakin bincike akan kananan kwayoyin da dabo bi domin cike gurbin kamar ta FDA don binciken sabon maganin dan gwajin kiwon lafiya akan mutane zai iya dauka matakai na samun yardar hukumomi da sabon neman izi ni na savboon maGAni.

sourceString: Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
targetString: Samar da maganin covid -19 ko da na waraka ne akan fara shi fa samar da sinadari da gaskiyar prophylacti mechanism ko da maganin a gaba ko aikin antiviral a vivo.

sourceString: New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
targetString: Sabbin abubuwan kimiyyar sunadarai (NCEs, wanda kuma aka sani da sabbin kwayoyin halitta ko NMEs) sune mahadi waɗanda ke fitowa daga hanyar gano magunguna don tantance maganin alurar rigakafi ko ɗan takarar rigakafi.

sourceString: These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
targetString: Waɗannan suna da aiki mai banƙyama ga wata manufa ta rayuwa game da cutar COVID-19.

sourceString: At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
targetString: A farkon maganin alurar rigakafi ko haɓaka magunguna, ba a san ƙarami game da aminci, yawan guba, pharmacokinetics, da metabolism na NCE a cikin mutane.

sourceString: It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
targetString: Aiki ne da wajibin ci gaban magunguna don tantance duk waɗannan sigogi kafin gwajin asibiti na ɗan adam don tabbatar da amincin da kuma inganci.

sourceString: A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).
targetString: a wani cigaban samar da maganin shi ne shawarar shan maganin da ma lokacin shan maganin do gwaji farko na kiwon lafiya (shan farko a jikin mutum FHD ko wanda akafi sani da shan farko a jikin mutum.FIH ko ma farkon mutum FIM).

sourceString: In addition, drug development must establish the physicochemical properties of the NCE: its chemical makeup, stability, and solubility.
targetString: Kari akan haka hada magani sai ya samar da properties physciochemical na NCE da mahadi sinadarin daidaito dana narkewa.

sourceString: Manufacturers must optimize the process they use to make the chemical so they can scale up from a medicinal chemist producing milligrams, to manufacturing on the kilogram and ton scale.
targetString: Masu masana'antu dole ne su inganta tsarin da suke amfani da shi don yin sinadaran ta yadda zasu iya haɓaka daga ƙungiyar chemist ɗin da ke samar da milligram, zuwa masana'anta akan kilogram da tan.

sourceString: They further examine the product for suitability to package as capsules, tablets, aerosol, intramuscular injectable, subcutaneous injectable, or intravenous formulations.
targetString: ana kuma cigaba da duba ayan don gyara mazubin a matsayin kwaya, aerosol, allurar jiki, aluuran subcutaneous ko mahadin intravenous.

sourceString: Together, these processes are known in preclinical and clinical development as chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC).Many aspects of drug development focus on satisfying the regulatory requirements of drug licensing authorities.
targetString: Tare, waɗannan sanannun hanyoyin an san su a cikin daidaituwa da haɓaka na asibiti kamar sunadarai, masana'antu, da sarrafawa (CMC) .Daukacin fannoni na haɓaka magunguna suna mayar da hankali kan biyan bukatun ka'idoji na hukumomin lasisi na miyagun ƙwayoyi.

sourceString: These generally constitute tests designed to determine the major toxicities of a novel compound prior to first use in humans.
targetString: Wannan duka ya kunshi gwaji da zai gano mafi yawan cikowar ta kwayar halitar kafin farkon amfani da shi akan mutane.

sourceString: The Canadian government announced CA$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian universities, with plans to establish a "vaccine bank" of new vaccines for implementation if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Gwamnatin Kanada ta ba da sanarwar dala $ 275 miliyan a cikin kudade don ayyukan bincike 96 a kan magunguna game da COVID-19, gami da masu neman rigakafin ƙwayoyin cuta da yawa a jami'o'in Kanada, tare da shirye-shiryen kafa “bankin rigakafi” na sababbin allurar rigakafin aiwatarwa idan wata cuta ta bulla ta ɓoye.

sourceString: Clinical trial programs involve three, multiple-year stages toward product approval, and a fourth, post-approval stage for ongoing safety monitoring of the vaccine or drug therapy:
targetString: Shirye-shiryen gwaji na asibiti ya ƙunshi matakai uku, matakai na shekaru don amincewa da samfurin, kuma na huɗu, mataki na amincewa bayan ci gaba na kiyaye lafiyar maganin ko maganin ƙwayar cuta:

sourceString: Phase I trials, usually in healthy volunteers, determine safety and dosing.
targetString: Fuska I na gwaji, yawanci lokaci a cikin masu sa kai da ke aikin lafiya, da allura.

sourceString: Phase II trials are used to establish an initial reading of efficacy and further explore safety in small numbers of people having the disease targeted by the NCE.
targetString: Mataki I na gwajin ana amfani da su wajen samar da ganewar muhimancin da sake duba lafiya cikin kalilan mutane masu samun cutar daga NCE.

sourceString: Phase III trials are large, pivotal trials to determine safety and efficacy in sufficiently large numbers of people with the COVID-19 infection.
targetString: gwajin zagaye na III manya ne, gwajin gabobi don tabbatar da kariya da ma gudananrwa ga mafi yawan mutane masu dake da covid-19.

sourceString: If safety and efficacy are adequately proved, clinical testing may stop at this step and the NCE advances to the new drug application (NDA) stage to begin marketing.
targetString: Idan an tabbatar da aminci da inganci sosai, gwajin asibiti zai iya tsayawa a wannan matakin kuma NCE ta ci gaba zuwa sabon matakin aikace-aikacen miyagun ƙwayoyi (NDA) don fara tallan.

sourceString: Phase IV trials are post-approval trials that may be a condition attached by the FDA, also called post-market surveillance studies.
targetString: Shashi na IV na neman yadda da magani za a saka kaida ta FDA wanda akre kira duba na karatun bayan kasuwa.

sourceString: In addition to the tests required to move a novel vaccine or antiviral drug into the clinic for the first time, manufacturers must ensure that any long-term or chronic toxicities are well-defined, including effects on systems not previously monitored (fertility, reproduction, immune system, among others).
targetString: bacin da bukatar gwaji don samo cikkaken magani ma wannan cuta a dakin gwaji kafron farko masu kamfanoni sai sun kula da dogon zango ko tsananin karfin na da wannan nasaba har ma da illa a jikin mutum ciki ma harda alamun da ba a kula dasu ba juna biyu, haihuwa, garkuwan jiki, dama sauran su.

sourceString: In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
targetString: A U.S, ana kiran wannan tsari "sabon sanyawar magani" ko NDA.

sourceString: A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
targetString: Tsarin gwajin asibiti na cin gaba ana iya canza shi azaman "Tsarin daidaitawa" wato “adptive design” idan tarin bayanai a cikin gwajin na samar da wayewar kai game da inganci ko rashin ingancin maganin.

sourceString: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
targetString: Hadin gwiwar duniya da gwaji na Turai na mutanen da ke asibiti tare da mummunar kamuwa da COVID-19 suna amfani da ƙirar canji don daidaita sigogi na hanzari yayin da sakamakon dabarun gwaji na gwaji ya bayyana.

sourceString: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
targetString: Tsarin daidaitawa tsakanin gwajin asibiti wanda ake kai yi na Matakai II-III akan jinyar magwajin na iya rage lokacin gwaji da kuma amfani da karamar take, da yiwuwar yanke hukuncin ko ci nasara, da daidaita canje-canjen ƙira don takamaiman gwaji a duk faɗin ƙasashen duniya.

sourceString: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
targetString: Yawancin 'yan takarar novel (NCEs) sun gaza yayin haɓaka magunguna, ko dai saboda suna da guba da ba a yarda da ita ba ko kuma saboda kawai ba su tabbatar da inganci kan cutar da aka yi niyya ba, kamar yadda aka nuna a gwajin asibiti na Phase II-III.

sourceString: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
targetString: rashin samun nasara dakunan magani ana danganta shi ne da yawan attrition an bukaci zabin farko na karon farko a yayin kirkirowar ke kashe aikin danye don gudun bata harka da faduwa.

sourceString: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
targetString: Wani bincike na shekarar 2010 ya kimanta farashin daloli biyu na aljihu don kawo sabon magani a kasuwa kamar dala biliyan 1.8 da dala miliyan 870, bi da bi.

sourceString: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
targetString: Kaso na tsakiya a takaice kimanin 2015-16 na samuwar magunguna 10 na daji yakai miliyan $648.

sourceString: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
targetString: A cikin bita na 2016 na 'yan takarar miyagun ƙwayoyi 106 da aka tantance ta hanyar gwaji na asibiti, jimlar kuɗin babban injin na masana'antun da ke da maganin da aka amince da su ta hanyar cin nasarar gwaje-gwaje na Phase III ya kasance dala biliyan 2.6 (a cikin dala 2013), adadin yana ƙaruwa a kimanin shekara 8.5%.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
targetString: Gwaje-gwaje guda bakwai suna kimanta magungunan da aka sake dawo dasu don maganin zazzabin cizon sauro, gami da karatuttuka guda hudu akan hydroxychloroquine ko chloroquine phosphate.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Magungunan rigakafin da aka sake dawowa sune yawancin binciken kasar Sin, tare da gwaje-gwaje 9 na Tsari na III a kan remdesivir a manyan ƙasashe bayan sakamakon rahoton na ƙarshen watan Afrilu.

sourceString: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
targetString: Da jagorancin kungiyar Bill da Melinda gates da ma abokan harkar na zuba jarin miliyan $125 don taimakwa hukumar lafiya ta duniya, yawan yaduwar cutar covid -19 in a watan maris ya faru wanda hakan yasa fara bijiro da magunguna da bincike da ma damar dabbakar warkar da cutar.

sourceString: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
targetString: Kungiyar Binciken Asibiti na COVID-19 wanda aka kirkira don daidaitawa da fadada sakamako daga gwajin asibiti na kasa da kasa game da mafi kyawun jiyya bayan kamuwa da cuta.

sourceString: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
targetString: A farkon 2020, da yawa an kafa ƙwayoyin rigakafin ƙwayoyin cuta don magance wasu cututtukan da aka sake dawo dasu ko haɓakawa a cikin sabon binciken bincike na asibiti don rage cutar COVID-19.

sourceString: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Don magani da aka riga aka amince da shi (kamar su hydroxychloroquine don zazzabin cizon sauro), gwaji na Matakai III-IV na ƙayyade a cikin daruruwan zuwa dubban mutanen masu kamuwa da cutar COVID-19 da yiwuwar amfani da magani wanda aka riga aka amince da shi don magance cutar ta COVID-19.

sourceString: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.

sourceString: Mild illnesses include some cases of the common cold (which has other possible causes, predominantly rhinoviruses), while more lethal varieties can cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.

sourceString: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.

sourceString: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.

sourceString: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.

sourceString: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).

sourceString: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.

sourceString: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.

sourceString: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.

sourceString: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
targetString: Sunan yana nufin bayyanar halayyar virions (tsarin kwayar cuta mai bada ciwo) ta na'urar gwajin kwayoyin cututtuka, wanda suke da yanki mai girma, yanayin faduwar gaba ƙirƙirar hoto mai kamanin wani kambi ko corona na rana.

sourceString: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
targetString: Wannan ilimin halittar jinni ta mahaifa shine kwayar halittar kwaya mai yada kwayar cuta, wadanda sune sunadarai a saman kwayar cutar.

sourceString: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
targetString: Coronaviruses manyan cututtukan pleomorphic spherical ne da babban sinkayen farfajiya.

sourceString: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
targetString: Ambulaf na kwayar cutar a cikin micrographs na lantarki sun bayyana ne a matsayin nau'ikan ƙarancin zanna mai walƙiya. Ambulaf ɗin hoto mai zagaya yanar gizo yana kunshe da ƙwayar lipid inda aka nuna membrane (M), ambulaf (E) da kariyar sunadaran (S).

sourceString: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
targetString: Shi ambulaf na lipid bilayer, furotin membrane, da nucleocapsid wanda ke kare cutar idan yana wajen tantanin halitar mai kariya.

sourceString: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
targetString: Coronavirus masu yawa na dauke da positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.

sourceString: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
targetString: girman kwayar cutar corona na fara wa daga 26.4 zuwa 31.7 kilobases.

sourceString: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Girman kwayoyin halitta yana ɗaya daga cikin mafi girma tsakanin ƙwayoyin RNA.

sourceString: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
targetString: Buɗe hanyoyin karantawar tantanin halita 1a da 1b, waɗanda suka mamaye kashi biyu bisa uku na abubuwan halittun, suna kwafin halittar/transcriptase polyprotein.

sourceString: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
targetString: Kwafin rubutu na polyprotein na kanka da keɓaɓɓun abubuwa don samar da kariyar rashin ci gaba.Furan gaba bayanan rubutu yana buɗe manyan tsare-tsare guda huɗu: ƙaru, ambulaf, membrane, da kuma nucleocapsid.

sourceString: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
targetString: Yaduwa tsakanin waɗannan hanyoyin karantawar tantanin halita wato reading frames sune hanyoyin karantawar tantanin halita na wata furotin.

sourceString: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
targetString: yawan accessory proteins da ma amfanin su na da tsari bisa da irin cutar corona.

sourceString: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
targetString: Yaduwar na farawa ne idan kwayar cutar ta samu ta hada jiki da madaukin ta mai armashi.

sourceString: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
targetString: Bayan abin da aka makala, kariya daga murkushe tantanin halitta kuma tana kunna mai karɓa a haɗe da furotin.

sourceString: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
targetString: Ya danganta da garkuwar mai garkuwar da ke akwai, janyewa da kunnawa yana ba da damar kwayar cutar ta shiga rukunin rundunar ta hanyar endocytosis ko fusion kai tsaye daga cikin kwayar ta hanyar garkuwar membrane.Don shigar a cikin kwayar mai watsa shirye-shirye, kwayoyin sunadaran sun rufe, kuma kayan aikinta sun shiga tantanin halitta cytoplasm.

sourceString: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
targetString: maajin na fassara ribosome zuwa ainahin budewar lunkin da gidan na cutar kwayar da ma launin tsayin polyprotein.

sourceString: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
targetString: Polyprotein yana da nasa proteases waɗanda suke manne da polyprotein zama cikin furotin da ba gina ba.

sourceString: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
targetString: Yawancin mara tsarin furotin coalesce suna haifar da multi-furotin replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).

sourceString: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
targetString: ainahin makamancin da iri na uku na ginin jiki na protein shine jigon RNA polymerase (RdRp).

sourceString: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
targetString: yana da alaka da sauyi ji juyin RNA GADA RNA strand

sourceString: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
targetString: Sauran sunadaran gina jiki a hadaddun taimaka cikin yin kwazo da tsarin fassarar.

sourceString: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
targetString: Misalin furotin na kayan more rayuwa, alal misali, yana samar da karin aminci ga kwafin ta hanyar samarda aikin tantancewa wanda RNA-RNA mai dogaro da Rikici ne. Daya daga cikin manyan ayyukan hadaddun shine a kwayoyin halittar kwayar cutar.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: RdRp yana hada synthesis na negative-sense genomic RNA kai tsaye daga positive-sense genomic RNA.

sourceString: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: Wannan ya biyo bayan kamanceceniya mai tari na hankali genomic RNA dag wanda ku raguwa na vGenomic RNA.

sourceString: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
targetString: Sauran mahimman ayyukan aikin hadaddun shine fassara kwayar halittar cutar genome.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: RdRp kai tsaye ya shiga tsakani tabataccin kwayoyin halittar-hankali RNA subgenomic kwayoyin daga na musu kwayar halittar-hankali ta kwayoyin halitta.

sourceString: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
targetString: Wannan yana biye da fassarar waɗannan ƙananan ƙwayoyin halittun RNA marasa ƙwaƙwalwa zuwa mRNAs masu dacewar su.

sourceString: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
targetString: Makamancin irin danshin RNA ka iya zama wajen haifar da kwayoyin cutar.

sourceString: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
targetString: MRNA sune alamun kwayar halitta ta ukun karshe ta cutar bayan an fara buɗe allunan karatun farko

sourceString: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
targetString: Wadannan mRNA ana fassara su da ribosomes na mai garkuwar zuwa sunadaran tsarin da kuma wasu hanyoyin kariya da yawa.

sourceString: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
targetString: Fassarar RNA tana faruwa ne a cikin ɗakunan endoplasmic reticulum.

sourceString: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
targetString: Tsarin kwayar halitta ta S, E, da M suna tafiya tare da hanyar sirrin shiga cikin ginin tsakiyar Golgi.

sourceString: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.

sourceString: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
